subject: Redirect to UUID URLs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26340, 'name': 'Ilya Etingof', 'email': 'etingof@gmail.com', 'username': 'etingof'}, {'_account_id': 27909, 'name': 'Aija Jauntēva', 'email': 'aija.jaunteva@dell.com', 'username': 'ajya'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-31 10:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-31 10:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Do we really need this configurable? Do we expect someone to say "screw names, I only trust UUIDs"? :)

On the other hand, using UUID for primary addressing is much more common, especially since names are not guaranteed to be unique (sigh).

So I suggest we just switch to UUIDs as primary addressing.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So I suggest we just switch to UUIDs as primary addressing.

My concern here is that when tripleo sets up BMC nodes, it (obviously) uses human-friendly names in all the scripts/configs etc. If we switch to UUID in the Redfish emulator, some software  in triple could potentially  attempt to list the nodes and find the names tripleo knows about (e.g. human-friendly names) in BMC reporting.

This is how `openstackbmc` script currently works in OVB - it never exposes UUIDs.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Right, but if you plan on people using sushy-tools outside of OVB, my comment holds: 1. names are not unique, 2. names can be changed.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Right, but if you plan on people using sushy-tools outside of OVB, my comment holds: 1. names are not unique, 2. names can be changed.

So that explains why it is made configurable. We could make it defaulting to UUID and re-configured for names when running in OVB.

BTW, virtualbmc works with libvirt domain names (which could be renamed), while the domains do have UUIDs as well. That makes me wondering if there is a benefit from having emulators loosely coupled with the backend VMs e.g. by addressing them by more fluid names as opposed to rigid UUIDs....?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> So that explains why it is made configurable

Not quite. It's a bad practice in openstack to leave too many options to people, especially when options are not really equal, and some have weird caveats. Cannot we fix OVB to use UUIDs?

Or maybe we can provided aliases, so that /redfish/v1/Systems/<Name> responds with HTTP 301 and Location: /redfish/v1/Systems/<UUID>?"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:15:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Not quite. It's a bad practice in openstack to leave too many options to people, especially when options are not really equal, and some have weird caveats.

Well, perhaps. On the other hand, this option has a fundamental cause - we need to map either of the two IDs (name/UUID) on to a single Redfish ID. We could make it static or configurable or duplicate the entries.

I am trying to say that may be this is not like a feature of the emulator. I see it rather as a necessity to resolve the ambiguity...

> Cannot we fix OVB to use UUIDs?

I need to research this. Off the top of my head it looks like an open-ended project. ;-)

> Or maybe we can provided aliases, so that /redfish/v1/Systems/<Name> responds with HTTP 301 and Location: /redfish/v1/Systems/<UUID>?

I will research Redfish in that regard. I mean if they have this concept of aliased resources. My uneducated feeling is that this may be an overkilling complication. Because we might end up doubling pretty much every Redfish resource. Possibly not just ComputerSystems, but may be also storage, NICs.... Because they seem to share the same fundamental trait - the naming duality. ;=)

The other potential caveat of aliasing is that it may undermine resource locking in the eyes of the client. If the client has no way to learn that one resource is actually the same as the other, it may attempt to use them in parallel..."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-13 15:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-15 18:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-15 18:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Or maybe we can provided aliases, so that /redfish/v1/Systems/<Name> responds with HTTP 301 and Location: /redfish/v1/Systems/<UUID>?

I am not convinced this is a robust design (clients could fail on 302, tripleo/infrared/devstack  could get confused not finding  the nodes they've just configured), but let's not block on this contention!

I've overhauled the whole emulator thing to make it redirecting  to the "canonical" URLs.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2018-11-16 10:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-28 12:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-30 18:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-12-01 11:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-12-01 13:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-12-04 12:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-12-10 23:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-10-31 10:08:23.000000000', 'message': 'Advertise ComputerSystems by name or UUID

Redfish ComputerSystem can be addressed by Redfish resource `Id`,
however the resource can also have `name` and/or `uuid` properties.
Unless the client has some prior knowledge, they first need to get
the systems collection to read the `Id` of available systems.

The Redfish emulator is backed by libvirt and nova hypervisors.
They can identify domains/instances by UUID and name. When it comes
to mapping VMs to Redfish resources, the emulator can use either VM
name or UUID.

This change introduces the `--advertise-system-uuid` command-line
option (along with the `$$SUSHY_EMULATOR_ADVERTISE_SYSTEM_UUID`
environment variable) to the emulator which makes it using VM name
instead of UUID for Redfish resource `Id`. The client still can use
both name and UUID in queries, this change is only about the way
how the emulator advertises the systems to the clients.

Prior to this change the libvirt driver advertised VM names
while nova advertised UUIDs. This change defaults both to names.

commit_message:
Redirect to UUID URLs

Redfish ComputerSystem is addressed by Redfish resource `Id`,
while the resource can also carry the `name` and/or `uuid`
properties.

Technically, Redfish emulator could respond to queries performed
against `uuid` and `name`. This change makes Redfish emulator
HTTP redirecting all queries performed against `name` to the same
REST endpoint addressing the same ComputerSystem by its `uuid`
as a more canonical.

Also, when listing ComputerSystems, `uuid` is now universally used.
Prior to this change the libvirt driver advertised ComputerSystems
names while nova driver advertised UUIDs.

Story: 2004306
Task: 27867
Change-Id: Ic5dab0a5642d65d832f66092b7bf178ec58a3655

In I66ed21cdcf42d0c2012062c8cf74305fecbec312 the condition meant
for the setup of the domain was mistakenly applied to all tasks
including laying down the template.

This patch moves the conditional which ensures the domain is setup
on the first host to the task in question to ensure that everything

Closes-Bug: #1804827
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that LDAP config is deployed on all keystone hosts

In I66ed21cdcf42d0c2012062c8cf74305fecbec312 the condition meant
for the setup of the domain was mistakenly applied to all tasks
including laying down the template.

This patch moves the conditional which ensures the domain is setup
on the first host to the task in question to ensure that everything
is good and well with the world again.

Change-Id: Icb7c2556306d459534e6791f16c7013d0e9fcaf5
Closes-Bug: #1804827

is not enabled in ironic, so it is only usable via its only CLI. This patch
fixes it and sets ironic-inspector as the default inspect interface.

Change-Id: Ia4c7839d15284f89c66c639c96c7bdc68443e5c6
Closes-Bug: #1805788
(cherry picked from commit 3b6f022712d431019edf5fa854f51e8579a01f13)

commit_message:
Enable ironic-inspector support in ironic when enabling ironic-inspector

Currently when enabling ironic-inspector via its environment file, its support
is not enabled in ironic, so it is only usable via its only CLI. This patch
fixes it and sets ironic-inspector as the default inspect interface.

Change-Id: Ia4c7839d15284f89c66c639c96c7bdc68443e5c6
Closes-Bug: #1805788
(cherry picked from commit 3b6f022712d431019edf5fa854f51e8579a01f13)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 11:34:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1806064

Change I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike
introduced a race condition where creating multiple
servers concurrently can fail the second instances quota
check which happens in conductor after the instance record
is created in the cell database but its related BDMs and
tags are not stored in the cell DB. When deleting the
server from the API, since the BDMs are not in the cell
database with the instance, they are not "seen" and thus
the volume attachments are not deleted and the volume is
orphaned. As for tags, you should be able to see the tags
on the server in ERROR status from the API before deleting
it.

This change adds a functional regression test to show both
the volume attachment and tag issue when we fail the quota
check in conductor.

Change-Id: I21c2189cc1de6b8e4857de77acd9f1ef8b6ea9f6
Related-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 5d514b33e28964b38aeb42a8dd5b93f3fc8ae239)
'}, {'created': '2018-12-09 11:39:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1806064

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1806064

Change I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike
introduced a race condition where creating multiple
servers concurrently can fail the second instances quota
check which happens in conductor after the instance record
is created in the cell database but its related BDMs and
tags are not stored in the cell DB. When deleting the
server from the API, since the BDMs are not in the cell
database with the instance, they are not "seen" and thus
the volume attachments are not deleted and the volume is
orphaned. As for tags, you should be able to see the tags
on the server in ERROR status from the API before deleting
it.

This change adds a functional regression test to show both
the volume attachment and tag issue when we fail the quota
check in conductor.

Change-Id: I21c2189cc1de6b8e4857de77acd9f1ef8b6ea9f6
Related-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 5d514b33e28964b38aeb42a8dd5b93f3fc8ae239)
(cherry picked from commit 5b7e904126f68a8c9f5250620393dcdee54336d8)

member role to the API, making it easier for administrators to

  - project members
  - project admins

commit_message:
Implement system member role domain test coverage

This commit introduces the system member role to the API, making sure
system members can execute readable operations, leaving writable
domain operations to system administrators.

Subsequent patches will include domain support for:

  - system admin functionality
  - domain user test coverage
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I1d21ba562b007b43fc36a7a2010d35591ca3bae5
Partial-Bug: 1794376
Partial-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
Invoke redhat-subscription role during upgrade.

Before performing an upgrade, the new repositories and
activation key should be configured. Rhsm is the service
in charge of performing the overcloud nodes registration,
so we need to enable the new repository/parameters in the
upgrade_tasks to point to the right repositories during
upgrade.
Also, after [0] got merged, the registration is being forced
via --force in case it fails for the first time. Plus,
there is also a new option that allows us to enable only
the repositories passed in rhsm_repos variable, disabling
what is not included and was enabled. We need to pass
this variable set to true during upgrades so we disable
the latest version repositories.

[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615689/

Change-Id: I10fb84baa67275ed1f01fbb5b1236a284f2c763e
Related-Bug: #1797138

commit_message:
MNAIO: If there is no secondary data disk, use the root disk

In order to allow testing within OpenStack-CI, we need to cater
for the ability to run the tooling without a secondary data disk.

This patch changes the tooling to try the detection, and if there
is no secondary disk it will just use the root disk for /data/images.

Change-Id: I56d76e68b6914b3e12948b022e0e702557684c50

This patch resolves the warning about using jinja braces
the conditional for the guestfish workaround task. While
doing so, the task is made idempotent and we also ensure
that the task that follows exits immediately on any errors.

Change-Id: I7ec254a96312e07229b0a5c799d4a98b5d9c8957
'}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Fix warning for guestfish workaround task

This patch resolves the warning about using jinja braces
the conditional for the guestfish workaround task. While
doing so, the task is made idempotent and we also ensure
that the task that follows exits immediately on any errors.

Change-Id: I7ec254a96312e07229b0a5c799d4a98b5d9c8957

I will correct the warning in the upgrade-check patch.

Concerning the defaults, there is a difference between the storage interface and the storage backend: influxdb will become the default backend of the v2 interface, and the v2 interface will become cloudkitty's default.

The change of defaults (backend and interface) will be done in another patch, which will depend on this one. We'd like to have this merged before setting the new defaults, in case some fixes are required."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-06 19:11:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Adding an InfluxDB storage backend

This adds an InfluxDB backend to v2 storage. It is much more performant than the
gnocchi backend, and adds support for grafana.

In order to avoid making this patch too big, the documentation will be updated
in another patch.

Support for InfluxDB installation in the devstack plugin will also be added in
another patch.

Change-Id: Icaa23acb1a4791aac0dd8afb122d561065193eea
Story: 2001372
Task: 24536

commit_message:
adding compute/cpu_shared_set option

For Rocky, Nova introduced compute/cpu_shared_set and libvirt driver
uses that option to specify set of pCPUs which will be used to put
emulator threads on. So guest vCPUs can be pinned on pCPUs which will
be entirely dedicated for them.

Change-Id: I88b2afda67a91266f21d2c870a76646262488db2
Closes-Bug: 1806434
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

commit_message:
introduce "reserved_huge_pages" option

The DEFAULT/reserved_huge_pages option will be required by NFV
deployments in order to let Nova compute service knows that some huge
pages allocated in the host are used by third-party components like
DPDK PMDs.

Since juju does not support yet list of strings options that one will
be exposed using semicolons in charm.

Closes-Bug: 1804169
Change-Id: I7faa3406a6bd27b9d924925ae93d40075eb0aff2
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

commit_message:
readthedocs.io support

rtd uses 'readthedocs' and 'readthedocssinglehtmllocalmedia' as
builder names. os-api-ref expected 'html' as builder name to
handle the css files correctly.
This change adds the support for the rtd builders.

Change-Id: I21a5144ada79c8c95846ce961169e2505db27a56
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Batch DVR ARP updates

Now that the neighbour code in ip_lib uses pyroute2,
we should be able to batch calls to increase
performance by using its IPBatch class.

In order to reduce calls into namespaces, the code
has been re-arranged to make all calls for each
device in a "batch", doing an initial call to
retrieve the device index on init.

Still needs ip_lib unit and functional tests.

Let's see if it even works first :)

Change-Id: I80f6f4490f8b8ff966f7b7bbdd8c02283aa1a92f
Closes-bug: #1511134

commit_message:
Do not accidentaly overwrite DATA_FILE

the ollect_rabbitmq_stats.sh file correctly
creates and uses a tempfile, except it writes
the colums headers to DATA_FILE, which is both
non-atomic and overwritten a few lines later with a mv.

Change-Id: I59a9279e67da26b483a0cac539abc8e40da3622b
Closes-Bug: #1806635

[{'created': '2018-11-22 14:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Lower cluster-recheck-interval to 1 minute

The upstream default for cluster-recheck-interval is 15 minutes. This
renders any quick timer effectively meaningless, as in many cases its

renders any quick timer (i.e. failure-timeout) effectively meaningless,
as in many cases their expiration will only be checked 4 times per hour.
This commit lowers cluster-recheck-interval to 1 minute, which ensures a

Change-Id: I756d53e7267e6fa1b6fb348e219e30bafe757360
Closes-Bug: 1804667

commit_message:
Lower cluster-recheck-interval to 1 minute

The upstream default for cluster-recheck-interval is 15 minutes. This
renders any quick timer (i.e. failure-timeout) effectively meaningless,
as in many cases their expiration will only be checked 4 times per hour.
This commit lowers cluster-recheck-interval to 1 minute, which ensures a
fine enough granularity for specifying timers on a scale of minutes,
without overly stressing the policy engine.

Change-Id: I756d53e7267e6fa1b6fb348e219e30bafe757360
Closes-Bug: 1804667

commit_message:
Add polling.yaml to managed configs

This change adds polling.yaml to the list of managed config files, for
Queens and above.  Two new config items are added alongside the
template, to take into account a choice between the two polling.yaml
files supplied with the Ceilometer source, one which has a small list of
pollsters and the other which has all pollsters.  Additionally the
change adds the option to set the polling interval.

Change-Id: Ifff72870cf79bea23dbd21586857dd832c9e1405
Closes-Bug: 1785933
Closes-Bug: 1652848

commit_message:
on bionic lxd is already present

On bionic lxd is already present, installing it via snap will create
two instances of lxd running which will make troubles during the
process.

commit_message:
remove idle_timeout's opt in favor of connection_recycle_time

In icehouse database/idle_timeout has been deprecated in favor to
database/connection_recycle_time. This commit reflects the change in
our templates.

Change-Id: I6814a9d61d24c713e7a5182bf9683a393cda06bb
Closes-Bug: 1805592
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

[{'created': '2018-09-20 15:04:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update messaging notification configuration

Change-Id: I35f13c4cb14e51e5e164db12011d9c053f1260eb
'}, {'created': '2018-09-21 20:44:30.000000000', 'message': 'Update messaging notification configuration

This patch removes the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have
separate rpc and notify messaging backends. For example, if the
transport_url isnot provided in the notification section of the
service configuration, the transport_url specified in the default
section will be used instead.

This patch conditionally selects the notifier driver. The noop
driver will be selected when notification publishing is disabled.
The messagingv2 driver is selected when notification publishing is
enabled.

Change-Id: I35f13c4cb14e51e5e164db12011d9c053f1260eb
'}, {'created': '2018-09-24 20:13:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update messaging notification configuration

This patch removes the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have

commit_message:
Update messaging notification configuration

This patch removes the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have
separate rpc and notify messaging backends. For example, if the
transport_url isnot provided in the notification section of the
service configuration, the transport_url specified in the default
section will be used instead.

Change-Id: I35f13c4cb14e51e5e164db12011d9c053f1260eb

subject: Fix error reporting in requirements.sh script
messages: [{'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nFine with that. Should we gather the file created in a later commit?'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-12-11 12:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-12-11 13:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 07:12:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix error reporting in requirements.sh script

The 'echo %1' in requirements.sh did just that, echoed %1 without
reporting the source of the pip error. This patch changes this
command to 'cat $1', which dumps the content of the file referred
to by $1. This content is the pip package to install. Upon failure,
the user can know exactly which pip build failed and search for the
relevant error message in the build log.

Change-Id: Ieb5c928c31f1a6673152a0b1a15f6efe21cc063e
"}]
owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Fix error reporting in requirements.sh script

The 'echo %1' in requirements.sh did just that, echoed %1 without
reporting the source of the pip error. This patch changes this
command to 'cat $1', which dumps the content of the file referred
to by $1. This content is the pip package to install. Upon failure,
the user can know exactly which pip build failed and search for the
relevant error message in the build log.

Change-Id: Ieb5c928c31f1a6673152a0b1a15f6efe21cc063e

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "decodestring()" by "decodebytes()"

decodestring() is deprecated alias of decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: I3be35466fce8d1325cc484b6d2b23f3f818cb08f

[{'account_id': 29452, 'date': '2018-11-08 13:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-08 13:19:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-12-06 04:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

While I do not feel qualified to delve into the deep intricacies of the English language with regards to an vs a usage, I will comment that this is a well formed patch set.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-12-11 13:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: Id432e8ba08baaa50976f4d1d8d105a4d38f110ae
'}]

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "decodestring()" by "decodebytes()"

decodestring() is deprecated alias of decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: I3d4038c729e3cf18bae2a5b2b7cbf97a30c1ac35

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 14:31:48.000000000', 'message': "Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

We also change the role venv tag var to use the integrated
build's common venv tag so that we can remove the role's
venv tag in group_vars in the integrated build. This reduces
memory consumption and also reduces the duplication.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Replaces 'developer mode' with an equivalent mechanism
   that uses the common role and is simpler to understand.
   We will also simplify the provisioning of pip install
   arguments when doing this.
2. Simplifies the installation of optional pip packages.
   Right now it's more complicated than it needs to be due
   to us needing to keep the py_pkgs plugin working in the
   integrated build.
3. Deduplicates the distro package installs. Right now the
   role installs the distro packages twice - just before
   building the venv, and during the python_venv_build role
   execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598957
Change-Id: Iecb64d28afe3acfbae7060af55c1a891310e5ef4
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 7126647d7d9f21242df9c57c5b8820fdf772cab1)
"}]
commit_message:
Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

We also change the role venv tag var to use the integrated
build's common venv tag so that we can remove the role's
venv tag in group_vars in the integrated build. This reduces
memory consumption and also reduces the duplication.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Replaces 'developer mode' with an equivalent mechanism
   that uses the common role and is simpler to understand.
   We will also simplify the provisioning of pip install
   arguments when doing this.
2. Simplifies the installation of optional pip packages.
   Right now it's more complicated than it needs to be due
   to us needing to keep the py_pkgs plugin working in the
   integrated build.
3. Deduplicates the distro package installs. Right now the
   role installs the distro packages twice - just before
   building the venv, and during the python_venv_build role
   execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598957
Change-Id: Iecb64d28afe3acfbae7060af55c1a891310e5ef4
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 7126647d7d9f21242df9c57c5b8820fdf772cab1)

commit_message:
Disable cinder api apache config in distro install

The Ubuntu cinder-api package installs apache and enables an apache
configuration for the cinder-api. Disable the configuration to avoid
a conflict OSA's cinder-api service installation.

Change-Id: I695b405dfd13351b352106ae01847f163905c4b1
(cherry picked from commit 236ff01c1d0d2474e40a5e44700186e9cd60eac2)

This allows us to implement jobs using a scenario called something

commit_message:
Implement AIO changes to allow test usage by roles

In this patch we change the 'scenario' for the AIO bootstrap
to allow it to be overloaded with any additional service names
which correspond to an appropriate conf.d AIO configuration file.

This allows us to implement jobs using a scenario called something
like 'aio_lxc_octavia' and it will implement the base AIO and add
the octavia service.

In order to make use of this for the experimental jobs, we change
the job names so that the appropriate services are deployed.

Related-bug: #1759784
Change-Id: If6b7e401021ea57a908a616ec8b86e7aa6798558
(cherry picked from commit ada265c8449334538a011300785634774787d54d)

commit_message:
Switch to using public endpoint for URIs

The URI options in Heat all need to be public facing or otherwise
any instances spawned by Heat could have problems working with
things like SoftwareDeployment's such as Heat.

This patch makes the appropriate changes.

Change-Id: I210cedbdc527d981c49ff52264ee6028242202d2
(cherry picked from commit 785fcfd33d29ddfee54f09cd6bf126990d64e4dd)

commit_message:
[docs] Clean up the AIO user story

Somehow the content has gotten all mixed up, resulting in a very
confusing story. This re-arranges the story to ensure that it follows
a basic sequence that matches the deploy guide and explains the right
things in the right context.

Change-Id: Ia395df90ed1c90aea7c3497d39f5acff9f954bcc
(cherry picked from commit 56b3bd1e245b0a98005ac1c7083d035a5ef65150)

[{'created': '2018-11-27 10:05:03.000000000', 'message': "Ensure AIO container_tech/install_method vars are namespaced

To ensure there are no clashes with the inventory and other uses
beyond the AIO bootstrap, we namespace the container_tech variable
and the install_method variable. This also allows us to use those
variables as the common base in all conditionals, rather than repeat
the use of the env var lookup here and there.

We also tidy up a bit of content in the user_variables.yml template and
the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook.

Finally, we remove the unnecessary specification of the
'bootstrap_host_scenario', 'install_method' and 'openstack_confd_entries'
variables in the playbook, given that they're now in the role defaults.

Change-Id: I5c276a2efed5e1b300fc72f2767abb008199571c

commit_message:
Ensure AIO container_tech/install_method vars are namespaced

To ensure there are no clashes with the inventory and other uses
beyond the AIO bootstrap, we namespace the container_tech variable
and the install_method variable. This also allows us to use those
variables as the common base in all conditionals, rather than repeat
the use of the env var lookup here and there.

We also tidy up a bit of content in the user_variables.yml template and
the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook.

Finally, we remove the unnecessary specification of the
'bootstrap_host_scenario', 'install_method' and 'openstack_confd_entries'
variables in the playbook, given that they're now in the role defaults.

Change-Id: I5c276a2efed5e1b300fc72f2767abb008199571c
(cherry picked from commit 74bebf5d57c6aa1a2b450361a6718b1fa382942b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 16:53:56.000000000', 'message': 'Remove recursive chown of /var/lib/ceph when adding directories to osd-devices

When adding directories to osd-devices (e.g. juju config ceph-osd
osd-devices="/srv/ceph1 /srv/ceph2"), the charm was recursively changing owner
and group for all files below /var/lib/ceph, for each added directory. This was
taking time and was not useful.

The fix is to remove unnecessary recursive chown on /var/lib/ceph, since ceph
already manages the ownership of the files itself.

Change-Id: I39a00591bc86ec49c4ced53eadce75ddb21e2431
Closes-Bug: #1795383
'}, {'created': '2018-12-07 07:28:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove recursive chown of /var/lib/ceph when adding directories

commit_message:
Remove chown'ing on adding dirs to osd-devices

When adding directories to osd-devices (e.g. juju config ceph-osd
osd-devices="/srv/ceph1 /srv/ceph2"), the charm was recursively changing
owner and group for all files below /var/lib/ceph, for each added
directory. This was taking time and was not useful.

The fix is to remove unnecessary recursive chown on /var/lib/ceph, since
ceph already manages the ownership of the files itself.

Change-Id: I39a00591bc86ec49c4ced53eadce75ddb21e2431
Closes-Bug: #1795383

commit_message:
Api performance enhancements

 - Topology code refactored to be more efficient
 - Backend APIs returning large data sets compress the response
 - Garbage Collector configured to collect when there are few
   collectable objects, rather then wait till there are many.
 - Garbage Collector called after every API call.

Change-Id: Ieda233932aff7e6621845544d94f73960ece834c
Depends-On: I5a908238cfd02616bd4a75470057157338530917

[{'created': '2018-06-22 22:56:17.000000000', 'message': 'Option to upload Octavia amphora img in RAW format

When deploying an overcloud with Octavia, the amphora image is uploaded
to Glance as QCOW2. When using the RBD backend for Glance and Nova, this
causes the image to be converted to RAW on each deployment. With slower
storage, this leads to load balancer creation to fail with a compute
timeout exception from Octavia.

This patch adds an option to allow amphora image to be automatically
uploaded to Glance in raw format.

Partial-Bug: #1778303
Change-Id: I698ed96881756bb547f5338b147b0c795103acb5

commit_message:
Option to upload Octavia amphora img in RAW format

When deploying an overcloud with Octavia, the amphora image is uploaded
to Glance as QCOW2. When using the RBD backend for Glance and Nova, this
causes the image to be converted to RAW on each deployment. With slower
storage, this leads to load balancer creation to fail with a compute
timeout exception from Octavia.

This patch adds an option to allow amphora image to be automatically
uploaded to Glance in raw format.

Partial-Bug: #1778303
Change-Id: I698ed96881756bb547f5338b147b0c795103acb5

commit_message:
Added Dell EMC SC multipath support

Added a new parameter CinderDellScMultipathXfer to
support cinder::backend::dellsc_iscsi::use_multipath_for_image_xfer
to the Dell EMC SC Cinder iSCSI volume driver template.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616687/
Change-Id: I04f42ce0cd117f7dcc7a817274ea7664d9995864
(cherry picked from commit 72eea3c6ea5969a834544cf38cd0a63f4c61d85d)

'}]
commit_message:
[validation] Filter Neutron sidecar containers

These containers by design are not restarted during upgrade, to prevent
dataplane disruption. As they use same image as the agents (which should
be checked), filter on the command: all these containers start with "ip
netns exec"

This will also catch OVN metadata sidecar containers, and other untested
sidecar containers (ipv6, ...) as well as fixing up existing Neutron
ones as a follow-up for Iedfce29a11b440f14b3880195ecaa0f0181fcb25

Change-Id: Icde32c6516cc253c574c853ad6a86425b79f11cd
Closes-Bug: #1807687
(cherry picked from commit c7a117854e32314464371ff214bcd88d6246be66)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary octavia scenario AIO bootstrap

The role itself handles the certificate generation and the
download of a pre-built amphora image by default, so there
is no need to do it in the AIO bootstrap. Also, several of
the overrides implemented are the same as the defaults, or
break the role execution, so we remove them to allow the
role defaults to be used instead.

Change-Id: If261478ce83b82e16da954e229bf4e7590ddcd4d
(cherry picked from commit e55960fe3096632ab0083424c2fc705daa55242f)

commit_message:
tasks: python: Add support for python3 environments

The venv and the Ceph modules could be based on python3 (eg openSUSE
Leap 15) so we must determine the correct paths during runtime.

Change-Id: Ie64c0ad96c11bf5d6041b41f8d34b1c3d03e824e

commit_message:
Add support for generic representors

This change adds a generic VF representor port profile to the os-vif
object model. This port profile is required to carry metadata to the
os-vif plugin, in order to configure the datapath on the host, when SR-IOV
based plugging is used.

Change-Id: I220ac6bd5bad1c4a1d978da8bc510765eecee488
Needed-By: I327894839a892a976cf314d4292b22ce247b0afa
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
blueprint: generic-os-vif-offloads

[{'created': '2018-11-14 14:02:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag

Overcloud nodes fail to pxe boot during overcloud deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enbled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the
the BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Change-Id: I2890bf16110b713e269d4a4fe410f57273dc8e83
Story: #2004340

commit_message:
Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag in idrac driver

Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the
the BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Change-Id: I2890bf16110b713e269d4a4fe410f57273dc8e83
Story: 2004340

commit_message:
Fix typo in option name.

We need to set workload_image_url fact when option
'--upgrade-workloadimage https://...' is specified, not when
'--upgrade-workload yes'.

Change-Id: Ia50dc158891cb4f6e18c36d6a3831dbf19e7982d
(cherry picked from commit 353589be3e0a818366ab483c7196b661650097a5)

commit_message:
Rename admin guide pages

Some of the admin guide pages were prefixed with "identity-" because
they came from the centralized install guide or operators guide or
security guide or somewhere else. We don't need the prefix, everything
in keystone is identity. Remove the prefix from the affected pages so
that everything is consistent.

Change-Id: Icd172a39fe720472f1fb15395178f90282696ac9

(1 comment)

One more required step for operators to take means one more step that is likely to be missed by operators trying to migrate.

I hate to say it, but I think adding a few lines to the tools/{mysq|postgresql|-migrate-db.sh scripts that will query Alembic for the latest DB version/stamp and call the new placement-manage db stamp $LATEST_VERSION would be a good idea...

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-04 00:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-04 00:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Okay, everyone in the room has addressed to do this stamping in upgrade scripts. Can I do that in a separate patch [1] since A) that's an additional change and B) I guess the script change depends on a grenade change [2] to pass the tests while this adding stamp cli capability patch doesn't.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/621733
[2] https://review.openstack.org/620485"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-10 13:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

However the rest of the discussion related to this resolves, we still need the command, so...'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-12-11 10:18:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

It seems that Jay's and Matt's last issue about the stamping in the migration script is being solved separately in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621733/ so I'm approving this.

Cheers,
gibi"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-27 05:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add alembic version stamp capability to the DB

Now we have `placement-manage db sync` CLI, which upgrades the
placement DB to the current version using alembic. However, if you
have already created tables in placement, the command fails on having
the initial upgrade: (initial) -> (b4ed3a175331). This is because it
assumes the initial DB has no contents and tries to create the tables.

Since this can be a problem for nova-api -> placement migration case,
where we expect placement DB has tables before starting alembic
version mangement via the migration script in `tools/*-migrate-db.sh`,
this patch provides a way to stamp the current version via the CLI:
`placement-manage db stamp <version>`.

commit_message:
Add alembic version stamp capability to the DB

Now we have `placement-manage db sync` CLI, which upgrades the
placement DB to the current version using alembic. However, if you
have already created tables in placement, the command fails on having
the initial upgrade: (initial) -> (b4ed3a175331). This is because it
assumes the initial DB has no contents and tries to create the tables.

Since this can be a problem for nova-api -> placement migration case,
where we expect placement DB has tables before starting alembic
version mangement via the migration script in `tools/*-migrate-db.sh`,
this patch provides a way to stamp the current version via the CLI:
`placement-manage db stamp <version>`.

Change-Id: I65fa8fd6e2479224f1b25cd62ca15a90d5948424

commit_message:
Correct the base class for v2 l7rules type tests

The v2 L7rules type tests should base on v2 types.

This patch fix the incorrct import and add some missing
cases for v2 L7rules type tests.

Change-Id: I029163531b3f5bd87781e87d5c1b8e326c49d252

commit_message:
Docs for regex, workers, container_cli and environment_files

While porting scenario jobs to standalone, we have added
test_white_regex to run a specific test, tempest_workers in order
to allocate number of cpus to run tests in parallel, container_cli,
and enviroment files used in scenario standalone jobs .
This patch updates the documentation for the same.

Change-Id: Ia60c3ba30278bc86de979d9ad62c6c20be07e0ec

commit_message:
Add advanced configuration of container images

Indoduces yaml editor as a second step of container images configuration
wizard. This lets user review generated configuration and tweak details.

Story: 2004509
Task: 28235
Change-Id: Icbd074112ac8caa5faca378aca4fd07b3992185f

commit_message:
Add container images configuration wizard

Add wizard to configure container images, introduce form to provide
images configuration and run container_images_prepare_default Mistral
workflow. Default configuration is loaded if ContainerImagePrepare
parameter is not yet populated. User can also reset the configuration
to default

Story: 2004509
Task: 28234
Change-Id: I739eb86e43276a9c27b5136522515c7104b12d86

commit_message:
Install python3-redis for Fedora

Fedora repo [1] has python3-redis package, consuming it.

[1] http://trunk.rdoproject.org/fedora/stable-base/latest/Packages/

commit_message:
Implement system reader role in domains API

This commit introduces the system reader role to the API, making it
easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities to
the API by default.

Subsequent patches will include domain support for:

  - system members test coverage
  - system admins functionality
  - domain user test coverage
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I2e0a5de931049627e6ceb48b1c0e44205f3388e1
Partial-Bug: 1794376
Partial-Bug: 968696

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 18:10:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "configure container (other services)" when statement

Configure container (other services) task should be executed when
cinder_volume uses other than lvm as backend (for example. rbd). But the
existing code completely skips both "Configure container
(cinder-volume)" and "Configure container (other services)" tasks. So
the cinder_volume container is not properly initialized when using rbd as
backend.

Change-Id: Ieb195e8a0cd3435fa3e872b609717aadc2ff41e8
Closes-Bug: #1780789
Closes-Bug: #1756005
(cherry picked from commit 92427a6531aca062d3e4cb536b0db55992aa0ef6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "configure container (other services)" when statement

Configure container (other services) task should be executed when
cinder_volume uses other than lvm as backend (for example. rbd). But the
existing code completely skips both "Configure container
(cinder-volume)" and "Configure container (other services)" tasks. So
the cinder_volume container is not properly initialized when using rbd as
backend.

Change-Id: Ieb195e8a0cd3435fa3e872b609717aadc2ff41e8
Closes-Bug: #1780789
Closes-Bug: #1756005
(cherry picked from commit 92427a6531aca062d3e4cb536b0db55992aa0ef6)

subject: Make generate_config_file_samples python3 compatible
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 13:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make generate_config_file_samples python3 compatible

On some distros, like Fedora, python3-oslo-config package provides
python3-oslo-config-generator script instead of oslo-config-generator
script.
This patch adds logic to choose script file which is available on
local system.

Change-Id: I11982bf818f5252d16be5445db322574eaaed3bd
'}]
commit_message:
Make generate_config_file_samples python3 compatible

On some distros, like Fedora, python3-oslo-config package provides
python3-oslo-config-generator script instead of oslo-config-generator
script.
This patch adds logic to choose script file which is available on
local system.

Change-Id: I11982bf818f5252d16be5445db322574eaaed3bd

messages:
[{'account_id': 29657, 'date': '2018-12-11 10:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-11 10:31:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Allow to skip docker reconfiguration during stack update

When installing OpenShift by means of TripleO, after
the initial docker configuration, openshift-ansible
also adds several parameters there.

Then, if we want to remove a single node, then a stack
update is performed, which returns the configuration
to its original state. In other words, it removes all
parameters added by openshift-ansible, which breaks OpenShift.

This commit adds the ability to disable reconfiguration of
docker at the time of stack update for all roles associated
with OpenShift.

Closes-Bug: #1804790

Depends-On: I0bcaeea9cd24ab35a81d8c3d6fc3a384c1e4c3c2
Change-Id: If202be5d27d81672e39cbe21867459d277220e23

Thank you for updating the commit message! So, this patch is for a kind of a misconfiguration by users? If so, how about putting a warning message to the log(STDERR)?

And I'm still not sure about the benefit of this patch. As you mentioned in the commit message, tempest uses STDOUT stream to return outputs like a test names list. But, why do we need to care about like the misconfiguration (if so)?"}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

This is a workaround for an error design of oslo_log. A command line tool should never write log messages to STDOUT. STDOUT is for tools output to be consumed by another tool. For example tempest can be used to list available tests taking values from STDOUT, but if oslo_log writes log messages to STDOUT then it introduces errors in the captured output. STDERR exists exactly with this purpose: send messages to human being and therefore is the right place where to write log messages when no other preference is given by user. This workaround simply makes impossible to oslo_log to write to STDOUT and makes tempest to write messages log to STDERR by default instead.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-06-14 07:01:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

IMPORTANT NOTE: without this patch listing test using tempest CLI would be impossible in the case config.py is imported because config.py writes messages (by default) on STDOUT. Below command would produce an unclean output:

 tempest run -l

This problem has been after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559069/ change probably because tempest.config module is imported earlier than before. This bug was latent to be cough, just it weren't seen before because of a lucky coincidence. It was cough thanks to the failure of this test case:
 https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/tests/cmd/test_run.py#L109-L124"}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-06-14 10:03:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

Federico Ressi wrote:

> IMPORTANT NOTE: without this patch listing test using tempest CLI
> would be impossible in the case config.py is imported because
> config.py writes messages (by default) on STDOUT. Below command

>
> This problem has been after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559069/
> change probably because tempest.config module is imported earlier
> than before. This bug was latent to be cough, just it weren't seen
> before because of a lucky coincidence. It was cough thanks to the
> failure of this test case:  https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blo
> b/master/tempest/tests/cmd/test_run.py#L109-L124

Thank you for your reply! But I'm still not sure..
Does this patch fix an actual issue or potential issue?

Because I could get a clean output when I run tempest like this `tempest run -l > ~/tmp/tempest-run.txt` without this patch. Probably, I just miss something but I'd like to clarify. Is there any easy way to reproduce this issue?"}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-06-15 15:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Patch Set 24 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-06-15 15:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

Without this patch, this other patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559069/

would make test test_run.py to fail.

This happens because config.py would be imported before the output of 'tempest run -l' is written to STDOUT.

The reason you can't see it is because you didn't applied patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559069/."}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-06-18 06:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Patch Set 25 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-06-18 07:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 16:29:34.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

Because tempest uses stdout to return outputs (like for example
to list tests) it should never write logging lines to it.

If in oslo.log cannot found a valid destination in conf where to write
log messages it choses stdout. This workaround make oslo.log to choose
stderr instead of stdout on such case.

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-04-11 10:53:58.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

to list tests) it should never write logging lines to it.

If in oslo.log cannot found a valid destination in conf where to write
log messages it choses stdout. This workaround make oslo.log to choose
stderr instead of stdout on such case.

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 08:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

Because tempest uses stdout to return outputs (like for example
to list tests) it should never write logging lines to it.

If in oslo.log cannot find a valid destination in conf where to write
log messages it choses stdout. This workaround makes oslo.log to choose
stderr instead of stdout on such case.

Here is the undesired behaviour this change wants to mitigate:
  https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/3.38.0/oslo_log/log.py#L365-L369

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 09:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

Because tempest uses stdout to return outputs (like for example
to list tests) it should never write logging lines to it.

If in oslo.log cannot find a valid destination in conf where to write
log messages it choses stdout. This workaround makes oslo.log to choose
stderr instead of stdout on such case.

'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 10:37:20.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

stderr instead of stdout on such case.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-11 13:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid log to write to stdout

Because tempest uses stdout to return outputs (like for example

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 16:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid oslo.log to write to STDOUT

Because tempest uses STDOUT stream to return outputs (like for example
to list test names), then tempest should never write logging lines to STDOUT
stream, and use STDERR instead.

But when oslo.log cannot find in tempest.conf a valid destination
where to write log messages to, it decides to use sys.stdout to create
a logging stream handler with, therefore causing all logging messages
to be written to STDOUT stream instead of STDERR stream.

You can see the oslo.log code doing it at below link:
  https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/215cc3a8ec5cb61a365a98d731d08ae2f13d46d1/oslo_log/log.py#L364-L369

This workaround ensures oslo.log will always setup with STDERR
stream instead of STDOUT stream by temporary setting sys.stdout reference
with STDERR stream just a moment before logging stream handler is created. Then it
restores original sys.stdout reference to STDOUT to allow tempest to write
to STDOUT stream for other purpouses than writing logging messages.

Please note that as the logging handler used to write logging messages is created
with std.stdout referencing to STDERR stream passed as constructor argument,
it will continue referencing to STDERR stream even after sys.stdout reference is restored
to the original STDOUT stream. Therefore this will ensure oslo.log will always write
logging messages to STDERR instead of STDOUT.

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 16:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid oslo.log to write to STDOUT

where to write log messages to, it decides to use sys.stdout to create
a logging stream handler with, therefore causing all logging messages
to be written to STDOUT stream instead of STDERR stream.

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64
'}, {'created': '2018-07-23 17:47:48.000000000', 'message': 'Forbid oslo.log to write to STDOUT

Because tempest uses STDOUT stream to return outputs (like for example
to list test names), tempest should never write logging lines to STDOUT
stream, and use STDERR instead.

When oslo.log cannot find in tempest.conf a valid destination
where to write log messages to, it decides to use sys.stdout to create
a logging stream handler with, therefore causing all logging messages
to be written to STDOUT stream instead of STDERR stream.

You can see the oslo.log code doing it at below link:
  https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/215cc3a8ec5cb61a365a98d731d08ae2f13d46d1/oslo_log/log.py#L364-L369

This workaround ensures oslo.log will setup a logging.StreamHandler
with STDERR stream instead of STDOUT stream when no other logging
handler has been configured.

commit_message:
Forbid oslo.log to write to STDOUT

Because tempest uses STDOUT stream to return outputs (like for example
to list test names), tempest should never write logging lines to STDOUT
stream, and use STDERR instead.

When oslo.log cannot find in tempest.conf a valid destination
where to write log messages to, it decides to use sys.stdout to create
a logging stream handler with, therefore causing all logging messages
to be written to STDOUT stream instead of STDERR stream.

You can see the oslo.log code doing it at below link:
  https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/215cc3a8ec5cb61a365a98d731d08ae2f13d46d1/oslo_log/log.py#L364-L369

Change-Id: I98e75ed52f754a45d0774067fd1713bee2cecb64

commit_message:
[validation] Filter Neutron sidecar containers

These containers by design are not restarted during upgrade, to prevent
dataplane disruption. As they use same image as the agents (which should
be checked), filter on the command: all these containers start with "ip
netns exec"

This will also catch OVN metadata sidecar containers, and other untested
sidecar containers (ipv6, ...) as well as fixing up existing Neutron
ones as a follow-up for Iedfce29a11b440f14b3880195ecaa0f0181fcb25

Change-Id: Icde32c6516cc253c574c853ad6a86425b79f11cd
Closes-Bug: #1807687

subject: Allow to skip docker reconfiguration
messages:
[{'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-11-30 17:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-02 10:38:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Note to the reviewers: we have an issue with tripleo deployed openshift where both tripleo and openshift-ansible try to control docker daemon settings.

This works fine for initial deployment since tripleo applies its settings, then openshift-ansible applies its own settings on top of it. But for stack update, tripleo undoes all of openshift-ansible modification and restarts docker which causes an outage. We need a way to disable this behavior on already configured nodes (to the expense that we can't reconfigure any of the docker settings via tripleo after initial deployment)."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-03 10:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-03 12:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-03 13:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-03 16:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-03 20:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Restart still occurs - http://paste.openstack.org/show/736592/'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-03 20:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-04 13:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-04 13:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-04 14:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

http://paste.openstack.org/show/736592/ is captured from a 2nd run of the overcloud deploy command so docker restart still gets triggered.

Also afaik the handler gets triggered only on change and from the output the debug tasks isn't showing as changed:

2018-12-03 14:41:37,052 p=443682 u=mistral |  TASK [container-registry : debug] **********************************************
2018-12-03 14:41:37,052 p=443682 u=mistral |  Monday 03 December 2018  14:41:37 -0500 (0:00:00.402)       0:05:05.634 ******* 
2018-12-03 14:41:37,116 p=443682 u=mistral |  ok: [openshift-infra-2] => {
    "msg": "call handler to mark docker configured"
}
2018-12-03 14:41:37,169 p=443682 u=mistral |  ok: [openshift-infra-1] => {
    "msg": "call handler to mark docker configured"
}
2018-12-03 14:41:37,224 p=443682 u=mistral |  ok: [openshift-infra-0] => {
    "msg": "call handler to mark docker configured"
}'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-04 15:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-04 22:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Tested the patch locally and docker was restarted by the container-registry only once(during initial deployment).'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-05 15:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-05 15:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-10 09:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-10 12:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-10 15:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-10 22:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Allow to skip docker reconfiguration

This commit adds an option `container_registry_skip_reconfiguration`,
that, when enabled, disables the reconfiguration if docker has already
been configured once.

Change-Id: I0bcaeea9cd24ab35a81d8c3d6fc3a384c1e4c3c2
Related-Bug: #1804790

commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Change-Id: I3ad7e3006180b0790232b0a6ccd4b57e5be7a30d
(cherry picked from commit c265ae146bf7e7f10c76ddd53472574f51056b86)

commit_message:
Add tricircle-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for tricircle-status upgrade check commands.
For now it has only "check_placeholder" check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.
Story: 2003657
Task: 26160

Change-Id: I33c5cb6b89852749f4c1915ed70315d502774b64

commit_message:
Add tempest_workers to featureset_overrides

* tempest_workers var is used by validate-tempest role in order to
  allocate numbers of cpus while running the tests parallely. In
  order to complete scenario standalone migration, fs016 needs it.
  In order to improve the reusability of the job, we need to add
  this var under featureset_overrides.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/492

Change-Id: I84d8c2f766fd1dbbfbe8948737d08113f3041541

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 11:12:31.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Enhanced error messages

Unhelpful error received if image creation failed due to insufficient
free space

When glance CLI commands for image creation fail it returns a HTTP 500
error with a generic reason that provides no real explanation of the
failure.

Modify this behavior by returning a proper HTTP error code for
insufficient space and return a relevant message for this and other
failure cases.

More discuss needed:
1. v1 api is about to be removed now

Change-Id: I63b844c32b532d078e75353474c612a1b3cfef51
Co-authored-by: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Enhanced error messages

Unhelpful error received if image creation failed due to insufficient
free space

When glance CLI commands for image creation fail it returns a HTTP 500
error with a generic reason that provides no real explanation of the
failure.

Modify this behavior by returning a proper HTTP error code for
insufficient space and return a relevant message for this and other
failure cases.

More discuss needed:
1. v1 api is about to be removed now

Change-Id: I63b844c32b532d078e75353474c612a1b3cfef51
Co-authored-by: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
remove loop control when running include_role

When running an included role with_items + loop control is slow. This
change feeds the role the entire list of curated services which will
improve execution speed, especially when dealing with hundreds of hosts.

Change-Id: I48a303d12e749e6d27a7f57c6f2dd93a98d16f9c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
undercloud: enable undercloud_config parameter for validations

If TripleO Validations are enabled, we want to export UndercloudConfigFilePath
so the validations can work from the Mistral Executor container.

UndercloudConfigFilePath is set even if the preflight validations runs
are ommitted (when using the --no-validations option).

These parameters will be used in THT to feed hieradata and also bind
mount the undercloud configuration file.

Change-Id: I38f6d562ab452f765672e7cc4e71206b562c471b
Related-Bug: #1805825

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 10:03:43.000000000', 'message': "Update lxc_hosts SHA for CentOS systemd fix

There are a few manual workarounds that we're placing in order
to workaround old versions of machinectl however we don't actually
leverage those and they seem to be causing a dbus restart which
causes extra problems.

This patch updates the role SHA to include the fix in the lxc_hosts
role to ensure that CentOS builds work after the recent upgrade to
7.6.

Change-Id: I07fcbb33028677196892fbed6038487da87eb673
Closes-Bug: #1807405
"}]
commit_message:
Update lxc_hosts SHA for CentOS systemd fix

There are a few manual workarounds that we're placing in order
to workaround old versions of machinectl however we don't actually
leverage those and they seem to be causing a dbus restart which
causes extra problems.

This patch updates the role SHA to include the fix in the lxc_hosts
role to ensure that CentOS builds work after the recent upgrade to
7.6.

Change-Id: I07fcbb33028677196892fbed6038487da87eb673
Closes-Bug: #1807405

Instead, keep the test code the way it is and just added the necessary extra spec inspection. That should reduce the number of lines of code changed by this patch. I'd also remove the helper methods you put in the base test class(es).

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2017-10-31 16:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(4 comments)

We discussed offline some modification that would reduce the amount of code with Lajos. I dumped here the pseudo code we used during the discussion. 

cheers,
gibi

get_resource_request_from_flavor(flavor):
    # extra spec {resources:VCPU : 2,
                  resources:MEMORY: 1024}

    return ... #{resource_class : amount}

assertFlavorMatchesAllocations(flavor, allocations)
   request = get_resource_request_from_falvor(flavor)
   assertRequestedResourcesMatchesAllocations(request, allocations)


assertRequestedResourcesMatchesAllocations(request, allocations)
   for class, amount in request:
      assert(amount, allocations[class])


assertFlavorsMatchAllocation(old_flavor, new_flavor, allocations)
   # only call this if nova already summed the request from both flavor when it did the allocation in placement, like in case of resize same host
   request_old = get_resource_request_from_falvor(flavor_old)
   request_new = get_resource_request_from_falvor(flavor_new)

   request = request_old + request_new
   assertRequestedResourcesMatchesAllocations(request, allocations)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
WIP: ServerMovingTests with custom resources

To make the code easier to understand after the necessary refactoring
the assertFlavorMatchesAllocation was changed to
assertFlavorMatchesUsage, and that is called by
assertRequestedResourcesMatchesAllocations, which checks that all the
resources in the flavor and the extraspec are matches with the resources
in the allocations.

Change-Id: Iade57aa2d4e563670bc8c54e4c10c776d090a7da

commit_message:
Functional test for booting with nested resources

This patch adds a functional test where compute node has nested RP
providing some resources. It boots a server with a flavor that
requests resources from the nested RP and checks the allocations
come from both the compute host RP and the child RP.

Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tetsuro Nakamura <nakamura.tetsuro@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: Idc92d6b756e3f9735633e9924992490efe0eb22e

commit_message:
Fix environments sorting

This change ensures, that custom environments (which are not included in
capabilities-map.yaml) are applied at the end of list of sorted environments
rather than just skipped

Closes-Bug: #1806406
Change-Id: Ia682284eff26883434fc516aefa8591599ec4394

Choppy choppy.

commit_message:
Only enable OVN VIPs when ml2.ovn plugin is used

This patch updates the haproxy group_vars logic to only enable
OVN-related VIPs when the OVN ML2 plugin is used. It also removes
OVN bits from the inventory to be added as an env.d override
as needed.

Change-Id: Ied1e79965c340c1d4ca430a830199978782117d0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/623515

commit_message:
Set waiting status when number of OSDs has not yet reached expected-osd-count

The charm does not process relation requests from clients when the
number of OSDs has not yet reached the expected-osd-count.

Make this situation clear to the user by setting the charm status to
waiting with relevant information.

Change-Id: I638547ca4a9f1bf48782c82aa0d92f89f6bfd13a

This PS adds deployment of mistral-event-engine service
within mistral role.

Apache should be reloaded after watcher-api is disabled.

commit_message:
Move nova.libvirt.utils away from using nova.utils.execute().

We require it not.

Change-Id: I1509fd4225d7ac7e5da35f6f643222df5b73835c

[{'created': '2018-08-24 15:09:49.000000000', 'message': 'Move Octavia config opts to common config directory

Octavia fails to failover an amphora with its load balancer in
active-standby topology.

This issue is caused by a misconfiguration of Octavia by tripleo-common
where setting amp_boot_network_list and amp_secgroup_list are being

commit_message:
Move Octavia config opts to common config directory

Octavia fails to failover an amphora with its load balancer in
active-standby topology.

This issue is caused by a misconfiguration of Octavia by tripleo-common
where setting amp_boot_network_list and amp_secgroup_list are being
loaded only by the worker service. These two options are shared by the
worker and health manager services.

Closes-Bug: #1788571
Change-Id: Ibc73ece9bbd5dc0664fdc950ea48929a4b36b4a9

commit_message:
Support cpuset and scheduler for cpuset

This patch improves the numa objects, mem_available and mem_total are added.

This patch adds a parameter which named "cpu_policy" for Zun API to tag the mode of container.

This patch adds methods of node resource management for numa.

This patch also introduces a filter for cpuset.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic65b86ceb6f7d37c2b4ef545425e4edd20328282
Implements: blueprint cpuset-container

commit_message:
Docs: Fix VLAN bridge interface in example setup

The bridge_ports value defined on the example test setup file should
match the given physical interface and the VXLAN VLAN interface.

Closes-Bug: 1798079

Change-Id: I4a613bbb7b1790a9f289caa53f37917a4f618d04
(cherry picked from commit a6d8c79be40c70137bcd03ca6cb8924c2c48dfe7)

Paunch is not the service that's being controlled by these systemd files, podman is."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-12-06 17:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-12-06 19:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 19:21:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Sofer: replied inline

Jill: it was debated. I'm fine with either podman_ or paunch_. The thing with paunch_ is that we abstract the container engine to our operators which is the whole idea of Paunch tool.
If tomorrow we switch to k8s managed and still have systemd, we don't have to rename the systemd files (example with k8s, could be something else). If it's not ok for you, please let me know and I'm happy to find a consensus again.

Thanks all"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 20:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 21:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Prefix SystemD service by "tripleo_"

We now prefix the SystemD service so we can identify them better:
  e.g. systemctl list-unit-files | grep tripleo

It'll help to not conflict when rpms are installed on the host and
have the same service name as their container name.

For example haproxy rpm and haproxy container would have the same
service name so the prefix will help to not having this conflict
when removing the rpms during a cleanup by the operator.

Change-Id: I4bec5cfdb34c7422816c2d79ccaa5a499c783631

[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-24 16:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-11-24 17:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/619898/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 13s'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-24 19:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from policy-and-docs-in-code-patch6 to policy-and-docs-in-code'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

patch set 2 fails like http://paste.openstack.org/show/736920/

This is because the policy-in-code rules are loaded before registering extension resources as shown in L.33-50 of http://paste.openstack.org/show/736920/. Registered resources are only neutron core resources (networks, subnets, subnetpools and pors), so neutron.policy.FieldCheck cannot load 'convert_func" for address_scope (and other extended resources by API extensions) from attributes.RESOURCES. As a result, convert_func for field:address_scope:shared=True will return a string. (L.34).
From the fact above, enforce() raises an exception as we compare True (boolean) from input address_scope and "True" (string) from the policy-in-code.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 19:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from policy-and-docs-in-code-patch6 to policy-and-docs-in-code'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-12-10 21:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/619898/5 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 44s'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-11 05:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The workaround has been merged into the main patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585037/)'}]

commit_message:
DNM: TEST: Convert policy.json into policy-in-code

To check what happens when neutron/tests/etc/policy.json
Also check what happens for neutron-fullstack

patch set 3 adds a workaround to reload the policy-in-code rules
after loading API extensions per unit tests.

Change-Id: I142ff4897213368f7305c1ad701e80c234b85764

commit_message:
Allow RBAC on Neutron quotas

This patch adds the support to allow role based access control
on quota of resources.

Change-Id: I062e9cb4759b2d9e9c1f14bc662275bb03c548a2
Closes-Bug: #1671448
