Let's discuss this tomorrow :) looks like a big change and there is in progress some refactor instead of a purge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582502"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-12-05 08:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The code is not needed as of Stein, and FFU is for long time (downstream) releases. Maintaining/refactoring the code what is not needed is a waste.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-12-05 09:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-12-05 09:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-12-05 10:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Hi, so yes on the cleanup, but maybe some more though about it is needed.

So the main blocker here is the package removal. That should be left alone from that review and be done in another one.

Then, only some thoughs ...

So my understanding is that the way the podman systemd unit are named conflicts with the standard package.  Like the haproxy podman systemd unit file is named haproxy.  Is that correct ?

If so maybe one thing to consider as well, would be to have systemd unit file that have their own namespace for podman service.

Then some services are not cleanup[1] I guess this is because they are not conflicting with the podman systemd unit file.

My take would be:
 1. maybe considering non-conflicting name space for podman systemd unit file in https://github.com/openstack/paunch/blob/master/paunch/utils/systemd.py#L52..L53 . That would make them stand out in the unit list as well. but ..
 2. if the previous is too complicated (ie impact too many stuff) or doesn't make sense, then it would be better to make sure that *all* services are cleanup.  I guess the missing one are non conflicting for some reason.

If that blocks you in the testing (I guess there is some urge to delete ~3000loc), then we can just unlock this (provided the package removal is removed from the patch) and then continue the cleanup on top of it.

Thanks,
[1] :
 - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/rabbitmq.yaml#L179..L180
 - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/nova-consoleauth.yaml#L69..L70
 - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/nova-compute.yaml#L409..L410"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-05 12:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Jirka, @Sofer, are you good if I re-add package removal in this patch?

@Sofer, we used the same systemd service for podman on purpose, so our operators are already familiar with the names. In fact, we just use the container name. Does it make sense?'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-12-05 13:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, as far as i can tell, dropping anything that is aimed at the old systemd non-containerized services should be fine, as long as we keep the package removal code.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-05 13:24:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

+1 on removing the old systemd start/stop/validations, although I wanted to take advantage to bring a refactoring I'm working on to verify that the containers are up and running before running an upgrade: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582502/12

Seeing Emilien's patch, it's true that it makes sense to have a much simpler upgrade_tasks (for readability and improving the upgrade time), so what do you think if we would move the package_removal and the pre-upgrade validation tasks into external_upgrade_tasks?
This would allow us to run the container status validation outside of the upgrade process:
openstack overcloud external-upgrade run --tags validation

or for removing the packages (for example):
openstack overcloud external-upgrade run --tags remove_packages

Of course, this would be done in a follow up patch.

Also, as Jirka and Sofer mentioned, let's leave for the time being the package removal tasks in upgrade_tasks, and we'll take care of moving them to external_upgrade_tasks in a next step (if it's something that makes sense)"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-05 17:06:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we reached a consensus: I'll re-add the package removal tasks and we'll move it forward with this patch.

Thanks folks!"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-12-05 17:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

+1 to keeping the package removal tasks'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-05 18:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29068, 'date': '2018-12-05 18:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-12-06 06:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-12-06 09:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 12:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 14:09:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Just for the record, if UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages is set to true, the rpm removal will run systemd service stop command, which in fact stop the podman container during the upgrade.

I'll give more thoughts about it, but this is a side effect of keeping support for UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 14:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

a quick demo of my previous comment: https://asciinema.org/a/NjlIzdDaL4EcYNKIPNq8jibnO'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-12-06 15:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Just for the record, if UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages is set to true,
 > the rpm removal will run systemd service stop command, which in
 > fact stop the podman container during the upgrade.

Hum, maybe that means that podman systemd unit file should be "podman-haproxy" instead of "haproxy" ?  Maybe too far reaching to be doable, but maybe something to include in road map :)

That namespace conflict may hit us in some unexpected way, and package removal may be only one instance of it.

 > 
 > I'll give more thoughts about it, but this is a side effect of
 > keeping support for UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 17:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 17:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-06 17:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-07 11:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 19:39:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove upgrade_tasks that delete services and RPMs

We don't run the upgrade_tasks Ansible tasks that stop systemd services and
remove the packages since all services are containerized.
These tasks were useful in Rocky when we converted the Undercloud from
baremetal to containers but in Stein this is not useful anymore.
It's actually breaking upgrades for Podman, as containers are now seen
by systemd, and these tasks conflicts with the way containers are managed
in Paunch.

Change-Id: I6abdc9e37966cd818306f7af473958fd4662ccb5
Related-Bug: #1806733
"}, {'created': '2018-12-05 18:06:44.000000000', 'message': "upgrade: remove tasks that stop and disable services

We don't run the upgrade_tasks Ansible tasks that stop systemd services and
since all services are now containerized.
However, we decided to keep the tasks that remove the rpms in case some
of deployments didn't cleanup them in previous releases, they can still
do it now.
These tasks were useful in Rocky when we converted the Undercloud from
baremetal to containers but in Stein this is not useful anymore.
It's actually breaking upgrades for Podman, as containers are now seen
by systemd, and these tasks conflicts with the way containers are managed
in Paunch.

Change-Id: I6abdc9e37966cd818306f7af473958fd4662ccb5
Related-Bug: #1806733
"}, {'created': '2018-12-06 12:47:45.000000000', 'message': "upgrade: remove tasks that stop and disable services

commit_message:
upgrade: remove tasks that stop and disable services

We don't need upgrade_tasks that stop systemd services since all
services are now containerized.
However, we decided to keep the tasks that remove the rpms in case some
of deployments didn't cleanup them in previous releases, they can still
do it now.

Change-Id: I6abdc9e37966cd818306f7af473958fd4662ccb5
Related-Bug: #1806733

commit_message:
Use request_body_json function

Since the credential API and trust API were one of the first APIs
converted to flask, there weren't using a utility method to parse
JSON out of request bodies.

This commit makes both APIs re-use common code to get request
bodies.

Change-Id: Ic67fb1bc45018cdc6c3598adbc43cfc57f8592ab

subject: Delete segment and host shouldn't ignore not found error
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 09:01:30.000000000', 'message': "Delete segment and host shouldn't ignore not found error

If you pass non-existing segment-id to segment delete command, then
it shows `NoneType' object has no attribute 'to_dict` error on the
command console.

This patch fixes the above issue by passing `ignore_missing=False`
parameter to the segment and host delete client API so that it will
raise ResourceNotFound exception. Added unit tests for the same.

Closes-Bug: #1801905
Change-Id: I9aa0d5818cc8669b2f54fdc69ace3db2ea36e96d
"}]
commit_message:
Delete segment and host shouldn't ignore not found error

If you pass non-existing segment-id to segment delete command, then
it shows `NoneType' object has no attribute 'to_dict` error on the
command console.

This patch fixes the above issue by passing `ignore_missing=False`
parameter to the segment and host delete client API so that it will
raise ResourceNotFound exception. Added unit tests for the same.

Closes-Bug: #1801905
Change-Id: I9aa0d5818cc8669b2f54fdc69ace3db2ea36e96d

subject: Fix datetime microsecond discrepancy issue
messages: [{'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-11-07 04:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-11-19 08:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12950, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2018-12-11 04:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 04:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix datetime microsecond discrepancy issue

All ``POST/PUT`` restFul APIs which returns datetime parameters in the
response contains microseconds where `GET` APIs ignores microseconds part.

This patch fixes this issue by overriding `TimestampMixin` to exclude
microseconds part from the datetime fields.

Change-Id: Iff6367757c7c2832bf0c99e09f9c7a97c428d1cc
Closes-Bug: #1788883
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 08:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix datetime microsecond discrepancy issue

All ``POST/PUT`` restFul APIs which returns datetime parameters in the
response contains microseconds whereas `GET` APIs ignores microseconds
part. After a db object is created, it creates the datetime with
microseconds and the subsequent get db calls using the same session
object returns microseconds for the datetime fields.

This patch fixes this issue by overriding `TimestampMixin` to exclude
microseconds part from the datetime fields so that the subsequence get
db calls using the same db session object return datetime fields without
microseconds.

Change-Id: Iff6367757c7c2832bf0c99e09f9c7a97c428d1cc
Closes-Bug: #1788883
'}]
commit_message:
Fix datetime microsecond discrepancy issue

All ``POST/PUT`` restFul APIs which returns datetime parameters in the
response contains microseconds whereas `GET` APIs ignores microseconds
part. After a db object is created, it creates the datetime with
microseconds and the subsequent get db calls using the same session
object returns microseconds for the datetime fields.

This patch fixes this issue by overriding `TimestampMixin` to exclude
microseconds part from the datetime fields so that the subsequence get
db calls using the same db session object return datetime fields without
microseconds.

Change-Id: Iff6367757c7c2832bf0c99e09f9c7a97c428d1cc
Closes-Bug: #1788883

commit_message:
Deprecate pki related options

check_revocations_for_cached and hash_algorithms are deprecated for
removel because of PKI token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: I1ec9c946fb467e869df08a4697f89f9dd9a2b4db
Closes-Bug: #1804562
Closes-Bug: #1804720

commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Change-Id: Ib5245e5f13c8de41a6ca020be53781195903498d
(cherry picked from commit 844c493891bc51caf2911b86ce3059bdf0be6143)

commit_message:
Enable plugin in target branch

By default, devstack will enable plugin in master branch.
However, master branch might not be the branch we wanted.
In particular, if we are using stable branch, we want devstack
to enable plugin in stable branch instead of master branch.

This commit modifies the sample local conf to explicitly specify
the branch when enabling devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I1ce148f50e4d091e959b5c0d5b1b6281a07db946

As part of the docs consolidation effort, move the SSL recommendation to
the installation guides for each distro. This also corrects the wording:
"running in a web server" is not necessarily secure on its own, the web

Change-Id: If0b547680cbbea4c7f29d82de3f4fe96bd14b4ec

commit_message:
Move SSL recommendation to installation guide

As part of the docs consolidation effort, move the SSL recommendation to
the installation guides for each distro. This also corrects the wording:
"running in a web server" is not necessarily secure on its own, the web
server must be configured to use SSL.

Change-Id: If0b547680cbbea4c7f29d82de3f4fe96bd14b4ec

about the version of its companion package (libvirt). To ensure

commit_message:
Use the distro package for libvirt-python

The libvirt-python library has C bindings which are very particular
about the version of its companion package (libvirt). To ensure
things run smoothly for stable releases, we opt to use the distro
packages for these and symlink the appropriate library files and
binding into the venv.

This approach has been used successfully for the ceph and libvirt
python bindings in other roles.

Change-Id: I23bf430087af8b16a3d77d96f6ceb3d7f6d8a9d5

The repo build process does many git clone operations. This patch
ensures that the repo server git configuration allows git to detect
and make use of the number of CPU which are present, which
benefits operations such as check out which are highly threaded.

(cherry picked from commit a68a384a4f9808deada1fca43d686d7517fb6e6c)

commit_message:
Enable git automatic thread count detection

The repo build process does many git clone operations. This patch
ensures that the repo server git configuration allows git to detect
and make use of the number of CPU which are present, which
benefits operations such as check out which are highly threaded.

Change-Id: Ib01fc1c560dcb9261c328841d7472c87434edab0
(cherry picked from commit a68a384a4f9808deada1fca43d686d7517fb6e6c)

commit_message:
Import history for independent QA deliverables

Rarely-released QA cycle-independent deliverables never had their
release history imported. This should be done so that they do not
show up in governance/release gap analysis.

Note that we skip the erroneous "v0.0.4" tag for karma-subunit-reporter
and will issue a fresh 0.0.5 in another review to clear up any
confusion.

Change-Id: I3b8a7221eed9ede4cd749f6d766d09a1f965c79e

commit_message:
Handle missing or bad dmidecode

dmidecode isn't functional on all architectures.  Don't treat a missing
binary or a missing DMI table as fatal from an install POV.

Change-Id: I85f595f5fbb7fcd8c6dc589bb348e78148b80992
Related-Bug: 1790447

Patch Iaf8e13490adffaf4a606730f4758d064af69b2aa does not fix the problem

commit_message:
Use correct permission on Gnocchi tmp dir

Patch Iaf8e13490adffaf4a606730f4758d064af69b2aa does not fix the problem
with Gnocchi temporary directory completely. Gnocchi is still not able
to create new subdirectories. This patch makes the directory permission
more easy.

Change-Id: I6b13b0c4aaaa96684b3c7b782a2a2f5ff79e7f39
Closes-Bug: #1799522
(cherry picked from commit 948ab3f0ccb9327b0f93ee938971a3e8f5f09ca6)

commit_message:
Disable scenario003 multinode container on master

standalone scenario003 is the replacement, so we don't want to
waste resources for new changes.

Change-Id: I48d46000abdc9f18d4e9eb3f6c87f16a928238eb

commit_message:
Bump the timeout for plan creation workflow to 20 minutes

The default plan has grown. Processing of the plan is taking longer on
occasion, so it's reasonable to bump the timeout, instead of it being
razor thin.

Change-Id: Ieec42c2d31c88543922d4c9f01efd62758f9a7fb
Related-Bug: rhbz#1619704
(cherry picked from commit f8c2c83f890fef2923eedf40283ea8a0e83b5a7a)

commit_message:
Remove tripleo::profile::base::docker and docker_registry

We moved it to Ansible in Rocky, it's time to clean that up, it's not
used anywhere.

Change-Id: I7dfe7856c152a098e4375c2b3e23212ee3740c9f

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Fix for invalid device id length

The external reference supplied while managing an existing device
should be of exactly 5 digits as device ids on the VMAX array are
of exactly 5 digits. The VMAX driver should perform a check and throw
appropriate error.

Change-Id: I06cc3e107a5b07f8f00e9a9a025a0152199092df
Closes-bug: 1792889

commit_message:
Move "Public ID Generators" to relevant docs

Currently, the section "Public ID Generators" is a subsection of
"Identity sources" but it reads as very out of place. Looking at the
commit that introduced the section (1a50986e7c), it's clear this was
meant to be part of the domain-specific-config section and was missed in
a reshuffle. This patch puts it back in place.

Change-Id: I2873f104adf6af4da4ba23f8c0d8afb0c1161da3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 16:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Move nova-cells-v1 to experimental queue

Cells v1 has been deprecated since Pike. CERN
has been running with cells v2 since Queens.
The cells v1 job used to be the only thing that
ran with nova-network, but we switched the job
to use neutron in Rocky:

  I9de6b710baffdffcd1d7ab19897d5776ef27ae7e

The cells v1 job also suffers from intermittent
test failures, like with snapshot tests.

Given the deprecated nature of cells v1 we should
just move it to the experimental queue so that it
can be run on-demand if desired but does not gate
on all nova changes, thus further moving along its
eventual removal.

This change also updates the cells v1 status doc
and adds some documentation about the different
job queues that nova uses for integration testing.

Change-Id: I74985f1946fffd0ae4d38604696d0d4656b6bf4e
Closes-Bug: #1807407
'}]
commit_message:
Move nova-cells-v1 to experimental queue

Cells v1 has been deprecated since Pike. CERN
has been running with cells v2 since Queens.
The cells v1 job used to be the only thing that
ran with nova-network, but we switched the job
to use neutron in Rocky:

  I9de6b710baffdffcd1d7ab19897d5776ef27ae7e

The cells v1 job also suffers from intermittent
test failures, like with snapshot tests.

Given the deprecated nature of cells v1 we should
just move it to the experimental queue so that it
can be run on-demand if desired but does not gate
on all nova changes, thus further moving along its
eventual removal.

This change also updates the cells v1 status doc
and adds some documentation about the different
job queues that nova uses for integration testing.

Change-Id: I74985f1946fffd0ae4d38604696d0d4656b6bf4e
Closes-Bug: #1807407

commit_message:
Wait for volume to be available before attaching it

On slower test nodes we're seeing failures where the
2nd cinder volume created is not yet available by the
time we try to attach it to a server which fails with
a 400 InvalidVolume error. This fixes the bug by waiting
for the volume to be available before trying to attach it.

Change-Id: I833d79ecc97ddc844bf156ab64477c7c77424f20
Closes-Bug: #1807520
(cherry picked from commit 2f03ec23fd9f2fdafd9e064f04f9904a67a6cefc)

commit_message:
Wait for volume to be available before attaching it

On slower test nodes we're seeing failures where the
2nd cinder volume created is not yet available by the
time we try to attach it to a server which fails with
a 400 InvalidVolume error. This fixes the bug by waiting
for the volume to be available before trying to attach it.

Change-Id: I833d79ecc97ddc844bf156ab64477c7c77424f20
Closes-Bug: #1807520

commit_message:
Wait for volume to be available before attaching it

On slower test nodes we're seeing failures where the
2nd cinder volume created is not yet available by the
time we try to attach it to a server which fails with
a 400 InvalidVolume error. This fixes the bug by waiting
for the volume to be available before trying to attach it.

Change-Id: I833d79ecc97ddc844bf156ab64477c7c77424f20
Closes-Bug: #1807520
(cherry picked from commit 2f03ec23fd9f2fdafd9e064f04f9904a67a6cefc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 11:33:13.000000000', 'message': 'Create BDMs/tags in cell with instance when over-quota

If the server create build request fails the quota check
after the instance record has been created in a cell, we also
need to create the BDMs and tags in that cell so that users
can still see the tags on the server and so the API can
properly cleanup volume attachments when the server is deleted.

This change updates _cleanup_build_artifacts to create BDMs
and tags in the same cell as the instance prior to deleting the
build request and request spec and adjusts the assertions in the
related functional test to show the bug is fixed.

As for instances that get buried in cell0 due to scheduling
failures, the tags are not created there so comments are left
in those code paths to fix that issue as well, but that can be
done separately from this patch.

Change-Id: I1a9bdb596f74605ab4613c9cb2574e976aebbd8c
Closes-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 6d0386058b9628bbfcf64abdd707ad87ee19353c)
'}]
commit_message:
Create BDMs/tags in cell with instance when over-quota

If the server create build request fails the quota check
after the instance record has been created in a cell, we also
need to create the BDMs and tags in that cell so that users
can still see the tags on the server and so the API can
properly cleanup volume attachments when the server is deleted.

This change updates _cleanup_build_artifacts to create BDMs
and tags in the same cell as the instance prior to deleting the
build request and request spec and adjusts the assertions in the
related functional test to show the bug is fixed.

As for instances that get buried in cell0 due to scheduling
failures, the tags are not created there so comments are left
in those code paths to fix that issue as well, but that can be
done separately from this patch.

Change-Id: I1a9bdb596f74605ab4613c9cb2574e976aebbd8c
Closes-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 6d0386058b9628bbfcf64abdd707ad87ee19353c)

[{'created': '2018-12-07 15:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Report discard is supported

The RBD driver has supported discard (trim/unmap) since [1]. This patch
makes the driver advertise that it does so. Based on how the setting is
implemented, it is safe to hard code the value:

  "Report to clients of Cinder that the backend supports discard
  (aka. trim/unmap). This will not actually change the behavior of
  the backend or the client directly, it will only notify that it
  can be used."

[1] I094163b99d858384584966d65e9d8756c74a0c15

Change-Id: I2f1a4214c3a0561e6df99e8234a9b98f14139264
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Report discard is supported

The RBD driver has supported discard (trim/unmap) since [1]. This patch
makes the driver advertise that it does so. Based on how the setting is
implemented, it is safe to hard code the value:

  "Report to clients of Cinder that the backend supports discard
  (aka. trim/unmap). This will not actually change the behavior of
  the backend or the client directly, it will only notify that it
  can be used."

[1] I094163b99d858384584966d65e9d8756c74a0c15

Change-Id: I2f1a4214c3a0561e6df99e8234a9b98f14139264

commit_message:
Normalizing monasca webhook driver tables

This commit splits one alarm-notification table to three tables
namely alarm-notification, metrics and dimensions.

Due to circular dependency making this patch dependent on
another patch [0] that disable corresponding test.
Also another patch-set [1] doing required test is updated.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/600527/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597110/

Depends-on: I7966021c3f9c21d343ffc4412fe5f5b01cffe811
Change-Id: If6138710a0ee29320c3bdbefaffb9cc5df4b90c0
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-monasca-push-driver

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-11-28 19:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

What happens when you cancel a cluster create action that has desired capacity set to 10?  From my testing, the cluster create action will get cancelled but the node create actions are already in running status and will be created.  However, as soon as the cluster create action goes into cancelled status, the cluster lock is released and the user can perform other actions on the same cluster such as scale in.
So in that case node are being deleted while the nodes are still being created.'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-11-28 19:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The same problem happens when a deletion policy with lifecycle hook is attached.  If the a scale in action is cancelled, the node delete will be in wait for lifecycle completion forever.'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-29 23:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-29 23:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-29 23:19:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> How to confirm cancelled action is synchronized between Senlin and
 > driver（for example:nova）

The cancel is done with 'best effort'. So if an action is already running it will not be able to be canceled."}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-29 23:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> What happens when you cancel a cluster create action that has
 > desired capacity set to 10?  From my testing, the cluster create
 > action will get cancelled but the node create actions are already
 > in running status and will be created.  However, as soon as the
 > cluster create action goes into cancelled status, the cluster lock
 > is released and the user can perform other actions on the same
 > cluster such as scale in.
 > So in that case node are being deleted while the nodes are still
 > being created.

Yes, that is an intended consequence of canceling a parent action. The intent is to clear that cluster lock and signal any depended actions that are not already running to cancel. Otherwise I feel the action_update API would be kind of useless for canceling actions as most of the time you will be canceling action to recover from something that may be causing your cluster to stay locked.'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-29 23:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> The same problem happens when a deletion policy with lifecycle hook
 > is attached.  If the a scale in action is cancelled, the node
 > delete will be in wait for lifecycle completion forever.

Fixed.'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-11-30 00:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-11-30 04:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Add action_update api to cancel actions

This patch implements the action_update API to allow the status
of an action to be updated. For now we are only accepting
'CANCELLED' as a valid status value.

Implements: blueprint action-update
Change-Id: I76402401cb67bc9a2aa1df43ec0f28fc446f04bd

commit_message:
Fix POST and PUT methods of REST API

The json attribute was taken from the wrong object, so we got an error
for every POST or PUT request.
   AttributeError: module 'bottle' has no attribute 'json'

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 15:21:33.000000000', 'message': 'Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c
'}]
commit_message:
Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 11:24:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1806064

Change I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike
introduced a race condition where creating multiple
servers concurrently can fail the second instances quota
check which happens in conductor after the instance record
is created in the cell database but its related BDMs and
tags are not stored in the cell DB. When deleting the
server from the API, since the BDMs are not in the cell
database with the instance, they are not "seen" and thus
the volume attachments are not deleted and the volume is
orphaned. As for tags, you should be able to see the tags
on the server in ERROR status from the API before deleting
it.

This change adds a functional regression test to show both
the volume attachment and tag issue when we fail the quota
check in conductor.

Change-Id: I21c2189cc1de6b8e4857de77acd9f1ef8b6ea9f6
Related-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 5d514b33e28964b38aeb42a8dd5b93f3fc8ae239)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1806064

Change I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike
introduced a race condition where creating multiple
servers concurrently can fail the second instances quota
check which happens in conductor after the instance record
is created in the cell database but its related BDMs and
tags are not stored in the cell DB. When deleting the
server from the API, since the BDMs are not in the cell
database with the instance, they are not "seen" and thus
the volume attachments are not deleted and the volume is
orphaned. As for tags, you should be able to see the tags
on the server in ERROR status from the API before deleting
it.

This change adds a functional regression test to show both
the volume attachment and tag issue when we fail the quota
check in conductor.

Change-Id: I21c2189cc1de6b8e4857de77acd9f1ef8b6ea9f6
Related-Bug: #1806064
(cherry picked from commit 5d514b33e28964b38aeb42a8dd5b93f3fc8ae239)

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/cyborg-nova-pilot
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 22:02:20.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/cyborg-nova-pilot

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9eb1df906d9fc0bbb4c66abbe1571b1729954d57
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/cyborg-nova-pilot

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9eb1df906d9fc0bbb4c66abbe1571b1729954d57

commit_message:
Custom root configuration option

Instead of syntribos taking in ``--custom_install_root` during init and
``--syntribos-custom_root`` during run, which sometimes led to the custom root
option not being set correctly, the redundant config options have been
deprecated.

Change-Id: I95f4d345fe8a8608ff6d1daaf06ff49912917a3f

'--upgrade-workloadimage https://...' is specified, not when
'--upgrade-workload yes'.

'}, {'created': '2018-12-10 10:12:55.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to deploy overcloud with SELinux enabled

In docker-puppet.py script we try to relable
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules by adding ":z" suffix
in the end.

Unfortunatelly this operation is not allowed in docker with
enabled SELinux. Docker's error message is:

Error response from daemon: error setting label on mount source
'/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules': SELinux relabeling of
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules is not allowed:
"Relabeling content in /usr is not allowed.".

It leads to the fact that during the configuration the jobs fails
with "Permission denied - /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules"

There is no need to relable that folder since it's read-only.
After removing ":s" it is possible to deploy the overcloud with
enabled SELinux.

Closes-Bug: #1807680

commit_message:
Allow to run docker-puppet.py with SELinux enabled

In docker-puppet.py script we try to relable
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules by adding ":z" suffix
in the end.

Unfortunatelly this operation is not allowed in docker with
enabled SELinux. Docker's error message is:

Error response from daemon: error setting label on mount source
'/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules': SELinux relabeling of
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules is not allowed:
"Relabeling content in /usr is not allowed.".

It leads to the fact that during the configuration the jobs fails
with "Permission denied - /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules"

There is no need to relable that folder since it's read-only.
After removing ":z" it is possible to deploy the overcloud with
enabled SELinux.

Closes-Bug: #1807680

Change-Id: I11c7c5e9594fe0cdb2a114f81033651e411c9e3c

commit_message:
Enable delete bound trunk for linux bridge agent

For agent such as linux bridge which allows creating trunk on
bound port, this patch provides a fix to allow deleting trunk
without unbound port first. And it will help to keep the port
(trunk's parent port) working while deleting the trunk.

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Closes-Bug: #1794424
Story: 2003889

Change-Id: Iae2ae535bf3ba1548136bf3fe4306a42bad4e635

commit_message:
k8s-keystone create cluster roles and tests

This commit adds roles to kubernetes-keystone-webook policy
which has permissions similar to clusterrols cluster-admin,
edit and view present in kubernetes.

Check.sh script is also modified to test and verify the new
roles.

Change-Id: I43621d2e1036259064c805d97b340589a5b68c93

subject: Don't display router's is_ha and is_distributed attributes always
messages: [{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-10 22:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nOpenstack SDK version for Queens is too low'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 20:27:56.000000000', 'message': "Don't display router's is_ha and is_distributed attributes always

In case when is_ha or is_distributed attribute of Neutron's router is
set to None, it means that it wasn't returned from server and should
not be displayed.
Otherwise it might be confusing for user is making
openstack router show <router_name>
call as an admin will return e.g. is_ha=True but same call done as
regular user will return False or None.
It might happen like that because returning of those attributes is
forbidden for regular users in Neutron's policy.json

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567606/
Change-Id: I626b5193d9ecb308baad7b27939f9673c32b4182
Closes-Bug: #1689510
Task: 19789
Story: 2002110
(cherry picked from commit 8db3933feb35f91f3ff3d121c155286973c66122)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display router's is_ha and is_distributed attributes always

In case when is_ha or is_distributed attribute of Neutron's router is
set to None, it means that it wasn't returned from server and should
not be displayed.
Otherwise it might be confusing for user is making
openstack router show <router_name>
call as an admin will return e.g. is_ha=True but same call done as
regular user will return False or None.
It might happen like that because returning of those attributes is
forbidden for regular users in Neutron's policy.json

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567606/
Change-Id: I626b5193d9ecb308baad7b27939f9673c32b4182
Closes-Bug: #1689510
Task: 19789
Story: 2002110
(cherry picked from commit 8db3933feb35f91f3ff3d121c155286973c66122)

commit_message:
Request for creation of 2 feature branches: cyborg and its client.

The Cyborg PTL and myself should have write/merge permissions for
patches submitted to these feature branches.

The purpose of these branches is to develop a prototype to show how
Nova can call into Cyborg.

Change-Id: I117afbe4a8ddfc28140cd715665d212dde231202

[{'created': '2018-12-02 10:27:48.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure we unbind flat network ports and clear BM mac addresses

This patch fixes a bug in the ironic nova neutron interaction triangle,
where a port in a flat network can be left with bound and with the mac
address of a baremetal server if it is not deleted after a deployment or

commit_message:
Ensure we unbind flat network ports and clear BM mac addresses

This patch fixes a bug in the ironic nova neutron interaction triangle,
where a port in a flat network can be left with bound and with the mac
address of a baremetal server if it is not deleted after a deployment or
deployment failure. The fix is to ensure that the network interfaces
reset the mac address to a random mac address when it unbinds the port
in the unconfigure step for provisioning and tenant networks, and then
rebind and set the mac address for the configure steps.

Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Story: #2004428
Task: #28087
Change-Id: I11fff92e0a58ac68e795c003c14a336bceba6d89
(cherry picked from commit db16984b47afe014d2eadd32b56ccf1c347fb53d)

commit_message:
Enroll XClarity machines in Ironic's devstack setting

In the current XClarity CI environment, we have to manually
add XClarity machines. This patch is going to update Ironic's
devstack setting to enroll XClarity machines automatically.

Change-Id: I5f664706439c9c10311749b6a9b5520e2c1dc6db
Story: 2004577
Task: 28353

commit_message:
Bug fixes and error message updates

Fixes:
1) Crashes in runner and file_utils
2) Binary strings being read in as payloads

Updates:
1) Clarified error messages in parser
2) Confusing variable names in test cases vs issues

Adds:
1) A `syntribos root` CLI sub command to display the current syntribos root dir

Change-Id: I22edf7a1f3d39724522aee88d08b00d299b67248

messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-10 15:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just a question since I haven't tried the code yet, but this works Ok for admins right?  Since in that case the server does return True/False?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:06:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Just a question since I haven't tried the code yet, but this works
 > Ok for admins right?  Since in that case the server does return
 > True/False?

http://paste.openstack.org/show/720797/ - looks like it works fine :) I also checked router with ha=False and distributed=False - for admin those attributes are displayed, for regular user not :)"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Slawek - thanks, that's what I thought, nice job!"}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2018-05-11 07:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-05-16 09:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The attributes are still shown in the output of "router list", which I consider even more confusing, so that case should maybe be handled identically.

On the other hand I'm not sure on the effect this dynamic modification of columns might have on scripts that use this command, so I'm wondering whether a better solution would be to keep them in the output, but leave them empty instead of inserting the fake "False" value.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-18 20:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-18 20:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The attributes are still shown in the output of "router list",
 > which I consider even more confusing, so that case should maybe be
 > handled identically.

List should be fixed now.

 > 
 > On the other hand I'm not sure on the effect this dynamic
 > modification of columns might have on scripts that use this
 > command, so I'm wondering whether a better solution would be to
 > keep them in the output, but leave them empty instead of inserting
 > the fake "False" value.

I'm not sure if displaying "None", False, True values is better for users to understand which value means what. First of all, for scripts I think that SDK should be used, second thing is that IMO it still might be confusing if You will get ha=None when query done as regular user but ha=True as an admin for same router.
With this change it's clear IMO - no column, no privileges to get it.
I checked e.g. output of "openstack server show" command and its behavior is similar - as and admin I have e.g. "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname" columns and as an regular user I just don't get it at all.

However, if You and other OSC cores think that it's better to use "None" to show lack of privileges to get value, then this patch can be abandoned as it works like that with patch https://review.openstack.org/567606/ merged already to SDK repo'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-22 16:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-22 20:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-22 22:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-05-25 13:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I just noticed that there seem to be other locations showing similar behaviour. Like "network show" output contains "dns_domain: None" even if the dns extension isn't enabled. I'm wondering whether checking this for all neutron related functionality and fixing it in one batch might be better.

OTOH I'm still not convinced that adding lots of special case handling like this will really be an improvement. But I'm no core here, so I'll leave it for others to vote.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-05-25 17:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-25 19:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-25 19:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-06-01 19:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

* The behaviour should be consistent throughout OSC no matter what it is, it needs to be the same everywhere
* I personally think having columns/fields appear/disappear based on privileges or roles is bad UI.  Consider csv or JSON output also.  'None' is Python's "data-not-present" representation (not that it is the correct one to use, just why we use it).

Having a different representation for admin-only attributes seems do-able, but at a minimum I'd want all of the network commands to behave the same if not all of OSC.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thx for Your review Dean.

 > * The behaviour should be consistent throughout OSC no matter what
 > it is, it needs to be the same everywhere
 > * I personally think having columns/fields appear/disappear based
 > on privileges or roles is bad UI.  Consider csv or JSON output
 > also.  'None' is Python's "data-not-present" representation (not
 > that it is the correct one to use, just why we use it).

I agree with that but in case of e.g. SDK. Here it is tool used by many (sometimes not very technical) people and they don't need to think in "JSON style". So difference between False and None might be not very clear sometimes.

 > 
 > Having a different representation for admin-only attributes seems
 > do-able, but at a minimum I'd want all of the network commands to
 > behave the same if not all of OSC.

Please note that it's already like that for e.g. nova commands IIRC so it's already not consistent around whole OSC.
So what are You proposing? Should I go through all network commands in OSC and fix this behavior for all of them in one commit?
Or maybe can we merge this one like it is and we will try to do other things to be the same in future.'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-06-13 16:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:57:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Dean: please check my last comment and tell me what in Your opinion would be the best option here. I recently had another question from some user who was confused that his router is not configured as "ha" even when he expected it to be HA. Confusion came from this "None" value displayed in router's HA field for non admin user who don't have permission to check that.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-12-04 09:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-12-10 17:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 42155fae8cd64038ce0fc0de181070ad32a6f84a'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit bda3dac64bcbc424ffec001b512e2893bcee794d'}]

commit_message:
Don't display router's is_ha and is_distributed attributes always

In case when is_ha or is_distributed attribute of Neutron's router is
set to None, it means that it wasn't returned from server and should
not be displayed.
Otherwise it might be confusing for user is making
openstack router show <router_name>
call as an admin will return e.g. is_ha=True but same call done as
regular user will return False or None.
It might happen like that because returning of those attributes is
forbidden for regular users in Neutron's policy.json

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567606/
Change-Id: I626b5193d9ecb308baad7b27939f9673c32b4182
Closes-Bug: #1689510
Task: 19789
Story: 2002110

[{'created': '2018-12-08 00:04:33.000000000', 'message': 'vexxhost: tweak nodepool settings

This patch drops the VEXXHOST specific flavors from the Montreal
region because all of the SJC datacenter has *supported* and very
reliable nested virtualization.

It also bumps the max-servers to 10 in order to be able to supply
more results.

Change-Id: I6383772d6d1e1bca3a759692bf20d373baf588c6
'}]
commit_message:
vexxhost: tweak nodepool settings

This patch drops the VEXXHOST specific flavors from the Montreal
region because all of the SJC datacenter has *supported* and very
reliable nested virtualization.

It also bumps the max-servers to 10 in order to be able to supply
more results.

Change-Id: I6383772d6d1e1bca3a759692bf20d373baf588c6

Given that you have a comment for debian/ubuntu I think it would be reasonable to have a comment for RHEL/CentOS for the httpd case, but I'm okay with it as-is.

Essentially we're using customized CentOS images for the OpenStack services where we need to customize the OpenStack python code, and the stock openstack-helm images for the unmodified services.

The rationale for this is that our baremetal system is CentOS and our previous product (Titanium Cloud) was based on CentOS, so we were familiar with the low-level details of the OS."}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-12-06 00:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

 > our previous product (Titanium Cloud) was based on CentOS, so we
 > were familiar with the low-level details of the OS.

Please can we get some images for starlingx, I'm not comfortable with making patches to support an openstack distribution that is not open."}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-12-10 19:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove stale Apache2 service pids when a POD starts.

Stale Apache2 pids will prevent Apache2 from starting
and will leave the POD in a crashed state.

commit_message:
Enhance wait_service_status function

With this change, we will run the multithreaded
connectivity test only after we have verified that
all service's members are replying through the service
IP.

Change-Id: I1561653c00114e0f4636e2be12621a526c3a6ae3

'}, {'created': '2018-08-17 13:17:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add qdrouterd role for oslo.messaging backend deployment

This patch introduces the qdrouterd role for deployment
as an oslo.messaging backend when the optional amqp1
driver is selected for RPC. The qdrouterd is deployed
as infrastructure in a manner similar to the rabbitmq
server.

This patch:
* Update role requirements
* Update inventory and playbooks
* Add tests setup for qdrouterd backend
* Add experimental job (non-voting)

Depends-On: Ib7541da6f50aed75b428037f43ca7d0da7c27a21

commit_message:
Add qdrouterd role for oslo.messaging backend deployment

This patch introduces the qdrouterd role for deployment
as an oslo.messaging backend when the optional amqp1
driver is selected for RPC. The qdrouterd is deployed
as infrastructure in a manner similar to the rabbitmq
server.

This patch:
* Update role requirements
* Update inventory and playbooks
* Add tests setup for qdrouterd backend
* Add experimental job (non-voting)

Depends-On: I8f0941bd847f26e0ba5ec925606ee30396be9230
Depends-On: Ia66fe9a4c5c18f31fa50e06017389489be8c66a4
Depends-On: I35f13c4cb14e51e5e164db12011d9c053f1260eb
Change-Id: I9246eccf724919065825b14889724764ff8d2300

commit_message:
Adding AppArmor profile to Calico v3

- Adds AppArmor profile to the privileged pod
  using kubernetes_manadatory_access_control_annotation.
- Added apparmor install to the gate jobs.

Change-Id: I8b53e0b8ddc2695fa278481edf5688efa23ab06b

In queens, Ansible runs some tasks on localhost (overcloud nodes) so
ansible-role-redhat-subscription rpm is needed on the overcloud images
when we will run Ansible to unsubscribe the nodes on the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1807025
'}]
commit_message:
[queens-only] include ansible-role-redhat-subscription in base image

In queens, Ansible runs some tasks on localhost (overcloud nodes) so
ansible-role-redhat-subscription rpm is needed on the overcloud images
when we will run Ansible to unsubscribe the nodes on the overcloud.


Change-Id: I18e2bde1e20a9eb1840b237b840b407ecf1641cd
Closes-Bug: #1807025

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 14:54:05.000000000', 'message': "Mount puppet-generated directory for tripleo-validations

Tripleo validations relies on the /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated tree
to check out configuration files from the mistral_executor container. In the
inventory, the undercloud is known as 'localhost' and the validations are trying
to read those configuration files in the mistral_executor file system instead of
the undercloud host.

Change-Id: Ibc034a9fe7cef402743657058c551da00aaa6dc0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 642760e98a62aed9f2085e01839fafcf18a54fcd)
"}]
commit_message:
Mount puppet-generated directory for tripleo-validations

Tripleo validations relies on the /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated tree
to check out configuration files from the mistral_executor container. In the
inventory, the undercloud is known as 'localhost' and the validations are trying
to read those configuration files in the mistral_executor file system instead of
the undercloud host.

Change-Id: Ibc034a9fe7cef402743657058c551da00aaa6dc0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 642760e98a62aed9f2085e01839fafcf18a54fcd)

commit_message:
Use ansible debug stdout_callback on overcloud-deploy

Makes output more human friendly by avoiding collapsing stdett/stdout
lines as JSON.

Example: https://logs.rdoproject.org/33/614633/9/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001/f391bee/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz#_2018-12-06_09_34_21

We already adopted debug callback in other areas but it was not used
on overcloud-deploy.

Change-Id: Ibfcfa1858fd1326e88844516090c40f40dba21ed
Partial-Bug: #1787912

commit_message:
devstack: move master config to separate dir

It makes sense to keep the okd data dir tidy and the master generated
config in a separate directory.

Change-Id: I4cdef2222b189836891dbe8dd40d7d7a3058490a
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <celebdor@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove instack-undercloud and --use-heat

The instack-undercloud method of installing the undercloud was
deprecated in Rocky. We would like to remove the tie in via the
tripleoclient to reduce the overall package requirements when install
tripleoclient.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591858/
Change-Id: I3f1055ece3c267540bd4a94d42811b9146a09a86
Blueprint: remove-instack-undercloud
(cherry picked from commit ea904d09643fecf221b8c47289eb1b5252c97864)

This patch adds a new super useful log to __init__ method
which can be used for debugging.

Add new tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone job

scenario003-standalone job overrides a custom env file on
standalone_environment_files parameter.

commit_message:
Undercloud: Disable persisting VIPs in /etc/hosts

This adds the use-dns-for-vips.yaml which disables persisting the VIP
hosts to /etc/hosts. This is because sometimes we might be setting the
CloudName to an IP (for using IPs as keystone endpoints). Without this,
we'll get an erroneous value there.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/undercloud/test_undercloud.py
	tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_config.py

Change-Id: Ie28f51d6729f5f4b940bfcc8e77968dd57d41669
Closes-Bug: #1799724
(cherry picked from commit 6789f2e9a90de492f3b6c0b9f954ec0703948208)

[{'created': '2018-12-07 13:41:18.000000000', 'message': "Set facter variable 'uuid' explicitly in docker-puppet.py

Unprivileged docker-puppet-$service containers don't have access
to devices and can't get facter 'uuid' variable. Therefore per node
hiera customizations don't work. We can work around this by using
/sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid instead.

dmidecode>=3.1 returns system-id in lower case, so it's better to
use lowe case for compatibility.

This would also require changes to the docs as ironic node
introspection data may show it in both cases.

Change-Id: I899de7732c5b29ed70d4d487fdbc363117ac327f
Closes-Bug: #1806011
(cherry picked from commit 4de17945a1d5e9ed3aa2c535b426edf84936ded7)
"}]
commit_message:
Set facter variable 'uuid' explicitly in docker-puppet.py

Unprivileged docker-puppet-$service containers don't have access
to devices and can't get facter 'uuid' variable. Therefore per node
hiera customizations don't work. We can work around this by using
/sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid instead.

dmidecode>=3.1 returns system-id in lower case, so it's better to
use lowe case for compatibility.

This would also require changes to the docs as ironic node
introspection data may show it in both cases.

Change-Id: I899de7732c5b29ed70d4d487fdbc363117ac327f
Closes-Bug: #1806011
(cherry picked from commit 4de17945a1d5e9ed3aa2c535b426edf84936ded7)

commit_message:
Set `TraceEnable` directive for apache to 'Off'

Openstack service don't support TRACE requests, so there is little
point allowing TRACE for apache.

Change-Id: I396a4c3bfab8f353d038b011d5dc8029f4137a57
Closes-Bug: #1801298
(cherry picked from commit 2777c2b7d8ebb9144b2b6fea8649dbfae350c46b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-08 21:17:47.000000000', 'message': 'Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools, get_listeners,
get_healthmonitors, get_l7policies, get_l7policy_rules,
get_pool_members.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e

required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

commit_message:
Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools, get_listeners,
get_healthmonitors, get_l7policies, get_l7policy_rules,
get_pool_members.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
(cherry picked from commit 397a6fe39c72ac091d53da610682ec4f95ade2ed)

commit_message:
Disable pacemaker on multinode-containers (fs010)

The integration between podman and pacemaker is still work in progress.
While it's being done, let's remove pacemaker from this job, so we can
have at least one CI job running with podman on the overcloud.
We still have coverage for pacemaker in the container-upgrade jobs.

This patch will likely be reverted once we have pacemaker + podman
ready for centos7.

Change-Id: I8638386c8f394c98b047fb2ae4ff97daeeaf4475

commit_message:
Re-implement keepalived restart without pre_deploy

... and use host_prep_tasks from config-download.
We are trying to HostPrepConfig resource that use OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig
and the old fashion to run Ansible, for more native config-downlaod.
undercloud_pre is the only service that needs HostPrepConfig now, so
let's switch to config-download.

It restarts keepalived container at each undercloud install & upgrade.
Also it adds support for podman as it uses container_cli variable.

Note: the workaround can still be removed once we have Keepalived 2.0.6
but it won't happen before CentOS8 probably.

Change-Id: I7454013c2e37058b5010a2a6cacfae0d0f873744
Related-Bug: #1791238

As agreed with Monty during summit - this is a try to reuse and create standard interface.

[{'created': '2018-11-20 12:01:26.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor tag support

align different services to comply the same `tag` standard:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html
Currently not all services support tags, but we can prepare SDK for 
that.
There are some changes/issues to know:
- image.add_tag and image.remove_tag return the image entity
- server.query_params for tags are renamed to be compliant with rest of 
services (the ones from network are reused)
- cinder does support only setting of the tags, but not getting (API 
limitation)

As of now the only services with tagging API available:
- compute.server
- network.{net, subnet, ip, port, qos_policy, router, sg, sg_rule, 
subnet_pool, trunk}
- image.image

Change-Id: I7368c48baf414af325dad2b0579b094c803321bf

commit_message:
Refactor tag support

align different services to comply the same `tag` standard:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html
Currently not all services support tags, but we can prepare SDK for
that.
There are some changes/issues to know:
- image.add_tag and image.remove_tag return the image entity
- server.query_params for tags are renamed to be compliant with rest of
services (the ones from network are reused)
- cinder does support only setting of the tags, but not getting (API
limitation)

As of now the only services with tagging API available:
- compute.server
- network.{net, subnet, ip, port, qos_policy, router, sg, sg_rule,
subnet_pool, trunk}
- image.image
- identity.project

Change-Id: I7368c48baf414af325dad2b0579b094c803321bf

commit_message:
Change the overcloud delete command to use undeploy_plan

We don't have a CLI command to properly undeploy the overcloud.
There is a workflow for it, and the GUI uses the right workflow,
but the CLI doesn't support it yet.

Updating "openstack overcloud delete" command to call the proper workflow

Added a release note because this is not a backwards compatible change

Change-Id: If14a7876445b052cd255cdd5142ff400a815ace9
Closes-Bug: #1802102
(cherry picked from commit 2ac2e9b57de791c6c5936bb63d979d9c47f186a5)

During upgrade, as we don't use instack_undercloud anymore, we missing
the _member_ role to the admin user.

This creates the necessary hooks in tht to have the member role
created during upgrade (and install for that matter).

This passes on the keystone_enable_member to puppet-tripleo, but it
needs a patch there as well for this mechanism to fully work.

commit_message:
Enable _member_ role for undercloud install.

During upgrade, as we don't use instack_undercloud anymore, we missing
the _member_ role to the admin user.

This creates the necessary hooks in tht to have the member role
created during upgrade (and install for that matter).

This passes on the keystone_enable_member to puppet-tripleo, but it
needs a patch there as well for this mechanism to fully work.

Change-Id: I2319ed876eba7f21c0e80444bf78ca080fef252a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611919
Partial-Bug: #1799177
(cherry picked from commit 1c64c2c07bcadefbb74c55fc21b6a2c7e3727e68)

commit_message:
Don't mount data folder

"data" folder mounted on host sometimes makes ODL
believe that it has boot features installed. So ODL
doesnot generate required files.

So don't mount that folder so that ODL can boot
properly on restart.

Closes-Bug: #1805859

Change-Id: Icb415f6ac379e757edfe6dd73f80484a6697d152

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 13:57:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add driver-side oslo_versioned objects.

Driver-side ovos can be used in each vendor-driver to report infos
periodically, it can be used in driver.update_tree() function like:
test_attribute = DriverAttribute(key="crypto", value="valuecrypto")
test_vf1 = DriverVF(nddame="test_vf1", address="00:00:00:09:09:00",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])
test_vf2 = DriverVF(name="test_vf2", address="00:00:00:09:09:01",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])
test_pf = DriverPF(name="test_pf1", address="00:00:00:09:09:01",
assignable=False, VF_list=[test_vf1,test_vf2])
test_acc = DriverAccelerator(...)
return DriverHost(...)

Specification can be see in [link].

Agent can should use get_from() function in driver_accelerator.py when
initilized.Also, it should use diff_save() function in
agent.resource_update().

Change-Id: Id6a0bfe4067662b1d66e7696a2377d0173f41002
'}, {'created': '2018-08-22 16:48:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add driver-side oslo_versioned objects.

Driver-side ovos can be used in each vendor-driver to report infos
periodically, it can be used in driver.update_tree() function like:
test_attribute = DriverAttribute(key="crypto", value="valuecrypto")
test_vf1 = DriverVF(nddame="test_vf1", address="00:00:00:09:09:00",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])
test_vf2 = DriverVF(name="test_vf2", address="00:00:00:09:09:01",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])

assignable=False, VF_list=[test_vf1,test_vf2])
test_acc = DriverAccelerator(...)
return DriverHost(...)

Specification can be see in [link].

Agent can should use get_from() function in driver_accelerator.py when
initilized.Also, it should use diff_save() function in
agent.resource_update().

commit_message:
Add driver-side oslo_versioned objects.

Driver-side ovos can be used in each vendor-driver to report infos
periodically, it can be used in driver.update_tree() function like:
test_attribute = DriverAttribute(key="crypto", value="valuecrypto")
test_vf1 = DriverVF(nddame="test_vf1", address="00:00:00:09:09:00",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])
test_vf2 = DriverVF(name="test_vf2", address="00:00:00:09:09:01",
assignable=False, attribute_list=[test_attribute])
test_pf = DriverPF(name="test_pf1", address="00:00:00:09:09:01",
assignable=False, VF_list=[test_vf1,test_vf2])
test_acc = DriverAccelerator(...)
return DriverHost(...)

Specification can be see in [link].

Agent can should use get_from() function in driver_accelerator.py when
initilized.Also, it should use diff_save() function in
agent.resource_update().

Change-Id: Id6a0bfe4067662b1d66e7696a2377d0173f41002

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 15:18:59.000000000', 'message': "ctlplane pre-alloc IPs - deprecated/non-deprecated role name

By default, Compute role template set's the deprecated_param_ips
parameter in roles data. This forces the use of the deprecated
names in paramer_defaults when using predictable IPs for the
ctlplane network.

To allow the user to either use the deprecated role name, or the
non deprecated role name in parameters defaults extend the
ctlplane_fixed_ip_set contition to use or logic to test for data
in either the deprecated name parameter or the new parameter.

In the server resource use yaql to pick the first element that
is not empty. The non-deprecated parameter name is prioritiezed.

Change-Id: Iedc65064c5efaa618c3d54df10bf09296829efd2
Closes-Bug: #1805482
(cherry picked from commit 7a1cd822f648384b24a85b81128c841b59e8d6aa)
"}]
commit_message:
ctlplane pre-alloc IPs - deprecated/non-deprecated role name

By default, Compute role template set's the deprecated_param_ips
parameter in roles data. This forces the use of the deprecated
names in paramer_defaults when using predictable IPs for the
ctlplane network.

To allow the user to either use the deprecated role name, or the
non deprecated role name in parameters defaults extend the
ctlplane_fixed_ip_set contition to use or logic to test for data
in either the deprecated name parameter or the new parameter.

In the server resource use yaql to pick the first element that
is not empty. The non-deprecated parameter name is prioritiezed.

Change-Id: Iedc65064c5efaa618c3d54df10bf09296829efd2
Closes-Bug: #1805482
(cherry picked from commit 7a1cd822f648384b24a85b81128c841b59e8d6aa)

commit_message:
Move job list to project-template

This commit moves lists of our Tempest CI jobs into a project-template
and makes our project definition use that template. This way we enable
the list to be reused in our kuryr-tempest-plugin to always keep it in
sync.

Also the lower-constraints jobs are removed here and a template with
them is added instead.

Change-Id: I34e328322538127d9c7d0b1d8f9b8edf853b8ace

messages:

recheck

Definitely addresses my need. Luckily service_decription is so refactored, that it is now that easy. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-12-10 15:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-27 20:27:04.000000000', 'message': "Register proxy directly in add_service

When adding an unknown service to Connection, the existing code was
adding the service's ServiceDescription. Unfortunately, adding a
Descriptor at runtime doesn't actually work and the added instance winds
up being unusable.

As add_service is an active call, we can assume that the person calling
it actually wants to use the service, so we don't need to hid it behind
an on-demand descriptor. Run _make_proxy directly and attach the
resulting proxy to the Connection.

Change-Id: I02aa1ebbd11bea33712a3cb82600abc1aed2a65a
"}]
commit_message:
Register proxy directly in add_service

When adding an unknown service to Connection, the existing code was
adding the service's ServiceDescription. Unfortunately, adding a
Descriptor at runtime doesn't actually work and the added instance winds
up being unusable.

As add_service is an active call, we can assume that the person calling
it actually wants to use the service, so we don't need to hid it behind
an on-demand descriptor. Run _make_proxy directly and attach the
resulting proxy to the Connection.

Change-Id: I02aa1ebbd11bea33712a3cb82600abc1aed2a65a

What I miss here is some real documentation reference. A usual https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html reference says nothing about such new extension and additional parameter.
What happens if client sets propagate_uplink_status, but the extension is not active in Neutron (exception or simply ignored)?

commit_message:
Fix requesting specific fields from ironic

Currently we try sending a Python dict in the query, which obviously
does not work. Convert fields to a comma-separated list first.

For chassis specify that the required API version 1.8 is supported.

Change-Id: Ie1c3230f4fd14a59237a55bab2e91f04d50529a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 20:48:35.000000000', 'message': 'Lower mistral-executor nofile to 1024

Containers inherit file descriptor limit from docker daemon (currently:1048576)
which is very high causing python2 subprocess to take very long and ansible
facts gathering to time out.

This patch defaults nofile limit to 1024 for mistral-executor, like it is
on the baremetal node.

Co-Authored-By: Yatin Karel <ykarel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia76fcb87fc98fd93d6f487dd40d407c0bc875ffd
Related-Bug: 1806073
(cherry picked from commit 55a22c5caf191d092d3cc1c3d558a90365efeb3d)
'}]
commit_message:
Lower mistral-executor nofile to 1024

Containers inherit file descriptor limit from docker daemon (currently:1048576)
which is very high causing python2 subprocess to take very long and ansible
facts gathering to time out.

This patch defaults nofile limit to 1024 for mistral-executor, like it is
on the baremetal node.

Co-Authored-By: Yatin Karel <ykarel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia76fcb87fc98fd93d6f487dd40d407c0bc875ffd
Related-Bug: 1806073
(cherry picked from commit 55a22c5caf191d092d3cc1c3d558a90365efeb3d)

commit_message:
Add openSUSE Leap to Keystone image layer info example

There are microbadger.com images for the different distibutions listed
in the "Keystone Image Layer Info" section. Add openSUSE there as
well.
Also sort the listed distros by name and prefix the images with the
distro name so it is more obvious which image is for which distro.

Change-Id: I50958ac839f51e7ad91312a0899a20c12c38229a

subject: test
messages:
[{'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2018-12-10 16:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add the os-resource-classes project

This is a library containing the names of the standard resource classes
in the Placement service. It is intended to standardize these names
across all deployments.

Change-Id: Id63810837b6b778b53e1dca922b44c87e04ffd23

commit_message:
Clarify release management for QA deliverables

devstack-vagrant does not need release management (the tool
is more continuously released).

devstack-plugin-ceph does not need release management either,
as it does not do releases nor uses cycle branches.

Change-Id: I2989e3c468ab8c9d9aab0f40f38c0dde755aa394

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 09:26:26.000000000', 'message': 'No release management for deprecated repositories

Some deprecated deliverables have no release management anymore,
but have not been removed from governance yet (as they are still
shipped in some maintained branches).

Neither release-management:none nor release-management:external
accurately describe that situation, so we introduce a new
release-management:deprecated to account for those deliverables
that do not need release management because they are on the
deprecation track.

Examples of this are tempest-lib, devstack-plugin-zmq and
devstack-plugin-pika.

Change-Id: I9c0f4270835d0df127ac2021a10db0f8660aecab
'}]
commit_message:
No release management for deprecated repositories

Some deprecated deliverables have no release management anymore,
but have not been removed from governance yet (as they are still
shipped in some maintained branches).

Neither release-management:none nor release-management:external
accurately describe that situation, so we introduce a new
release-management:deprecated to account for those deliverables
that do not need release management because they are on the
deprecation track.

Examples of this are tempest-lib, devstack-plugin-zmq and
devstack-plugin-pika.

Change-Id: I9c0f4270835d0df127ac2021a10db0f8660aecab

LOCI is continuously released, so it does not need release

Change-Id: I1df0a1ccb59c94eaad5f49eafcda3a8446c6d61e

commit_message:
LOCI does not need release management

LOCI is continuously released, so it does not need release
management. Mark it release-management:none to reflect that.

Change-Id: I1df0a1ccb59c94eaad5f49eafcda3a8446c6d61e

commit_message:
Change openstack-dev to openstack-discuss

Mailinglists have been updated. Openstack-discuss replaces
openstack-dev.
